Reviews.Title: “Great surprise downtown. Will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: RomanticTravelers888
Reviews.Content: My husband was here many years ago with his buddy when they were quite thrifty. He read the reviews about the remodeling and hesitated to take me here. He even had a backup plan in case this was too much of a "dive" for me. I am so glad we stayed here! The Gold Spike far exceeded my expectations! Ifor the price we paid, it is exceptional. We stayed in a corner suite on the 7th floor, which had a wrap-around balcony with sliding glass doors on both sides. It was 98 degrees out, so we did not use it too much. The room definitely looked as fresh, new, and clean as the photos. There was even a huge showerhead and curved curtain bar to make the shower even better. We did not watch TV, but did use the free wifi. Our room had 2 A/C units and a dining table for 4. We played the $3 blackjack here as well...how often can you find less that? My husband appreciated Guinness on tap...and probably the dealers in too-short skirts. The staff were friendly, and the casino floor has clearly been remodeled as well. Recommend adding soap dish in shower and put 2 soaps in the bathroom. We'll stay here on our next trip; I've stayed on the Strip but prefer downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Big surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed three nights at the Gold Spike. I went to Las Vegas for a work related event. I did not want to spend a lot of money and found the price at the Gold Spike to be what I was looking for. I did not have high expectations because the hotel was in the older part of Vegas. I was plesantly surprised with everything about the hotel. The hotel staff was great and very friendly. A large group ended up reserving most of the rooms at the hotel so there was a little confusion with whether I was in that group and checking out with them. The Hotel Manager, Mike Swain, took the time to correct the problem and explain the situation to me. I have never stayed in that section of Vegas, near the Freemont Experience, but enjoyed my stay so much I will definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike Suite is sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Bincheros
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the pool table suite on the 7th floor for three nights. Three of my buddies stayed in regular rooms on the 5th floor. The suite was great. Two queen beds and a nice flat screen. There is a separate room when you first walk into the suite that has a pool table. There is also a nice flat screen tv in the pool table room. The best thing about the suite was the outdoor patio. Plenty of room for all of us sit and relax. Great place to hang out. The rooms were comped, but I would stay here again and pay for the rooms if they were not comped. I like this place. Easy to get in and out of the hotel and easy to get to your room compared to the big hotels. Ate three meals in the cafe downstairs. Excellent food, excellent price. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently and have nothing but nice things to say. First, this is a BUDGET hotel. If you want anything more than an inexpensive, clean, comfortable room than you need to look elsewhere. (It was nicer than some Motel 6 rooms I have paid more than twice as much for!) I was a little unsure what it would be like after reading some of the reviews on here but I was pleasantly surprised. It's 1 short block away from Fremont street which was a great break from all the craziness over on that block. The staff were all very nice and attentive. The room we stayed in was spotless and recently remodeled. New paint, new furniture, remodeled bathroom. The king-size bed was comfortable and the mattress looked brand new. The A/C was nice and cold. I saw staff constantly vacuuming and cleaning all over the hotel every day. It was shiny and clean everywhere. We had no trouble getting a parking spot in one of their 2 surface lots over the 4 days we were there (and it was Easter weekend). The diner on the 1st floor was great! Most entrees were around $6 and the portions were very generous. We ate there 3 times and it was always delicious. There is no ice machine but you can take the bucket to the bar in the casino and easily get it filled. The pool looked very nice but since it is not heated it was a little too cold for me to get in. We never saw any "sketchy characters" hanging around that other reviewers mentioned and the casino has visible security guards all the time. We never felt unsafe. Overall I would definitely recommend this for the budget-minded traveller and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price.......no frills”
Reviews.Author: jaxkary
Reviews.Content: Stayed for March Madness and we were looking for a cheap place to stay. Based on the reviews we thought this would be a great choice. It was relatively clean and the price was great but you definitely get what you pay for. Just a basic room which was all we needed. My wife probably wouldn't have stayed in this room but since she wasn't on this trip it worked out fine. I think we could have found a little nicer place for just a little bit more in the same area. The casino is really smoky and the people walking around and gambling are....how do I put this.....interesting. They do have a little diner that has awesome food at a great price, anytime of the day or night. Ate there several times and didn't have a bad meal. The sports book is very small so we placed most of our bets at he El Cortez down the street.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: PSB_Mom
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room is cheap but you get what you pay for. There are no irons, no hair dryers, NO ICE MACHINES, no fridge...no bells or whistles. With only vertical blinds on the windows and no curtains, there is no such thing as dark in these rooms. It is broad daylight at 2 am. We were on the front corner just above the GOLD SPIKE sign which lit up the room like the 4th of July. After the first night, I asked to be moved to another room away from the sign. We packed our belongings and lugged from one end of a floor to the other end of another floor. I looked out the window and guess what...we were right above the SAME SIGN on the opposite end of the bldg. I called back and asked for a room on the other side of the bldg. Reluctantly, the desk clerk sent us packing to a third room. This one was back on the original floor, but in the middle of the floor and away from the signs...Thank God! Again I say, yes the room is CHEAP - but you get what you pay for!! Equal or below a Super 8 or Motel 6. Stay at your own risk!!

Reviews.Title: “An OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: chroy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gold Spike for 6 days, so I got a good idea of the place. GOOD: Remodeled rooms look good. The flatscreen tv and abundance of channels was nice and comfortable bed. In the casino, the restaurant offers good food at a low price and the bar and sportsbook are roomy and comfortable. The overally customer service was above average. NOT SO GOOD: Extremely slow/ inconsistent WIFI connection. $10/ night for a resort fee - there's no resort. Stop adding resort fees, it's annoying. This is not a good neighborhood. Seen many pullovers/ arrests/ police running after people with guns drawn. Most people walking in this area are shady - constantly asking for money. You really stand out as a tourist in this area, making you a target for crimes (just my opinion). The rooms don't ventalate well, the windows don't open and a/c turns off/on constantly. If your room faces the south direction, expect a bright room at night - no drapes just verticle blinds that block out virtually no light. Bathroom small, with narrow doorway, Casino slots are hand pay, taking 2-10 minutes to pay out, even the smallest amounts are hand paid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Like2Hike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the end of March 2012. Rate was decent considering there was a major convention in town. 88 a night incl taxes.The Gold Spike is a small but cozy. It has been recently remodeled and is clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I stayed in a non smoking king bed room. The bed was comfortable, the flatscreen tv was a good size and had a decent selection of stations. AC/Heater worked well, you set a temp and it turns on and off intermittently, it was a bit loud though. There are no ice machines on the room floors, you have to go to the bar and ask for ice, which the bartenders happily supply. Self parking is not plentiful, there are only two small lots, I actually lucked out the times I needed to park and found a spot. Otherwise you will need to valet park. Valet is complimentary, but if you tip it's not necessarily free. The Gold Spike is about a block north of the Fremont Street Experience, it's not a long walk. The casino is pretty minimal, with something they call sexy blackjack (girls in skimpy outfits dealing 21) and some slot machines. I didn't eat at the restaurant but for club members there is a 6.99 prime rib special. I actually like the Cal deals or Tony Roma's steak and lobster special (get there early otherwise it's a 1 hour wait). I like driving around so the parking thing is a bit of an issue, but overall I liked the Gold Spike and would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: stillalarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gold Spike in Downtown Las Vegas last week (March/2012). We normally stay else ware but wanted to try the spike because they just recently renovated the casino and hotel. Overall for the low price of the room I think I received a good value. Had the hotel been priced the same as the El Cortez my rating would be lower. As always, you get what you pay for and honestly, the hotel was not bad. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, and the price was low. The A/C in each room is loud and turns on and off every few minutes. They ran out of towel which was a negative. They charge a “resort” fee in addition to the room fee which is a minor rip off because the pool was cold and you could not get an extra towel. Also, we places a wakeup call that never came so I would not rely on a wakeup call to get up.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: We traveled with family and I had to find a downtown hotel for 2 nights for 3 couples. My brother recently stayed here so I said let's give it a try. I used the Las Vegas Advisor coupon for one night at $9.99 and got Friday night for $29.99 but they do have a "resort fee" each night for just under $9 per night.....?........but oh well for a Thursday and Friday it wasn't too bad. We had main tower rooms, once we figured everything out it was a good stay. Coffee shop very good-blueberry pancakes were excellent-drink service very good-video poker at bar with free drinks EXCELLENT! Overall good stay!! Patty in PA

Reviews.Title: “Resort fees added to vacation package”
Reviews.Author: Sandew16
Reviews.Content: I booked with Southwest Airlines Vacation as it seemed like a better deal than their website rates. The total for 4 days was $222 and was to include "fun book" with some values. When arriving, was told they were out of the books and I would also have to pay $35 for resort fees. I paid $31 for hotel fees in the package already. I checked out the pool ...you'd think they would warm it in February...it was about 60 degrees outside. No one was using the pool as it was freezing cold. I noticed the sign in the parking lot said from $39.99. I paid closer to $50 a night before the added hotel fees and taxes. Parking is limited unless you do valet, then they'll park in the city parking lot next to their lots. We were told the food in the Superbowl buffet was better than last year, well it wasn't....they had tacos last year. Guess for $9, you couldn't ask for much. Note: After emailing the manager when I returned home as he didn't return my call before I checked out of the hotel, he did refund my resort fee for $35. When I notifed Southwest Vacations, they also gave me a travel voucher, which hopefully no one else will have problems as I did in the future. As for the Casino, the slots in the casino do not pay out (cash or tickets)....you have to wait for an attendant. If it ever gets busy, you'd probably have a long wait.

Reviews.Title: “great price”
Reviews.Author: nathand72
Reviews.Content: i have stayed there many times. just stayed there again in feb 2012. would happliy stay again. price is great. food in the hotel is really good and a great price. ham and eggs hash browns and toast - 4.99. cant be beat. it is a very simple place, it is not fancy at all. but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good time”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Overall this a great hotel for the price. Got a reseravtion last minute for saturday night, the General manager was able to get me the cheapest rate on freemont. All the people who work there are friendly. Upon check in i was informed that i had the 24 K mini suite upgrade. Awesome room- about twice the size of there standard king.Very clean, had a litttle area with a couch and a dining table for 4. Its on the top floor and has a balcony as well. Like i said for the price, you cant beat it. I will be back in july to celebrate my B-day there.

Reviews.Title: “super dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: casnleo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. for a $15 fee I got to say with my 2 dogs and we even hung out by the pool with them. Totally recommend it, I will be back before the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fees”
Reviews.Author: Carl M
Reviews.Content: Could not believe it. Upon checking out I was charged, with taxes, $8.98 per day "Resort Fees". In the wildest images of imagination this place is not a Resort. The hallways stink, the furniture has cigarette burns, parking is limited. It’s definitely not a Resort. But then again, how could they charge “Dump Fees”..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!!”
Reviews.Author: blueesmrs
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 2 separate occasions in January.. New Years Even & then saturday a week later. Rooms nicely renovated, quite & easy stroll to Fremonst street. Would definately stay here again, some interesting characters around the hotel! but they didn't bother us. Parking great but on busy days you may want to get ther early to get a spot.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this small hotel Christmas day and the next for a nice weekend getaway with my Mom. Excellent location. Great price for a clean room. Parking on site was free. We got a free steak dinner our first night. Cute/small casino. Clean lobby, helpful staff. Great budget hotel! If you just want a clean room without spending a lot, this is great for you. Downtown right off Freemont, you can walk to everything from here, hop on the bus to the strip if you want, leave your car and have fun. I would equate it to something similar to a nice clean Motel 6. No frills but great value.

Reviews.Title: “BANG 4 YOUR BUCK!”
Reviews.Author: sara b
Reviews.Content: my partner and I stayed at the Gold Spike just days before Xmas on our way to Los Angeles, and we were quiet pleased. The rooms were cleaned, and there was free WIFI, not to mention a hair dryer, and double beds. Since it was an off season/holiday rate our room was almost FREE!!!! My family of 3 ate a couple different meals in the cafe located in the hotel/casino and we all agreed the food was GOOD!!

Reviews.Title: “Never judge a book by its cover...”
Reviews.Author: ktdelosreyes
Reviews.Content: When my husband booked this room, I was a bit worried as we passed by the hotel, all of the hotels in the Old Dowtown Strip/Freemont St. are old and dingy looking but when we walked into the doors, we found a beautifully renovated casino, all of the staff members we encountered were all very nice and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We only stayed 1 night but would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: very nice and they were helpfull in aug.2011 when i got stranded because of a hurrican on the east coast. everyone else was taking advantage of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't complain!"”
Reviews.Author: Peggy1023
Reviews.Content: On the upside: The staff seemed helpful. The little cafe off the lobby had excellent food for the price and fast, friendly employees. The room was clean and very reasonable - good location. On the downside: I called ahead and requested poolside - didn't get it. 3rd floor hallway reeked of vomit mixed with alcohol mixed with orange industrial cleaner of some sort. Once inside the room you could no longer smell it. Requested a poolside room again on 2nd of 3rd day visit. Finally on 3rd night after my kids left I was moved "almost" near the pool. Actually on the backside of the wall where the dumpster was and all night someone was heaving glass bottles it sounded like into the dumpster! Lovely. For my wake up call a security guard pounded on my door and when I said, "Who is it?" Nothing. Scared the crap out of me being all alone. I could hear him talking on his radio about my phone not working? It worked when I called to order the wake up call. Overall: SUCKED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected little gem!”
Reviews.Author: charlene A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for my sister in law's wedding just this last veterans day weekend. We were staying at another hotel (had i known about this one, i would have booked here!) and were walking around downtown Las Vegas near Fremont street and saw the Gold Spike. We are always intrigued in smaller places, we love what establishments such as this one has to offer as far as a little more quaint and not so packed that you can actually enjoy yourself. We went in and sat at the bar to play a little and have a drink. We sat there for a hour or two and then cashed out. The bartender was adorable! (my husband would say very good looking) She was very nice and accommodating. The security guard (did not catch his name) offered to bar back for her. This is when we started to realize what a great job they have all done with cross training their staff. It did seem everyone did just about everything. We then went over to see the games they had to offer and we sat at a few machines and played. A very nice waitress came by, Vangie, she was very helpful and when I cashed out after a few hours, she also paid me out. No ticket or coins to gather, they come to you and pay you cash! I had not expected this. She was Very busy, but she still kept her calm, professionalism and caring spirit. She was the only waitress/cashier person for the whole floor. We then realized, that we had been there for a few hours and really should have gotten a players card. We walked over to the players card area and the nice man helped us, he too was also security. He spoke to us about the casino and hotel and answered our questions, he was very knowledgeable. I am very sorry that I do not remember his name, but he for sure deserves a pat on the back, for not only going the extra mile, but also his customer service was exceptional. We were once again amazed at how all staff knew how to do all jobs. We then decided to eat at the café. With all of the choices in Las Vegas, we werent sure what to expect. We were seated and our waitress- Cole, was very nice and a little bouncy, lol but we enjoyed the conversation with her, a little banter and she made our experience worth staying. I did become upset however, a manager called her over and loudly spoke to her about not serving an employee, while she was taking our order. I agree that she took some extra time with us, we did have some questions as we had not been there before. The food was very good, my husband was impressed with the shrimp cocktail, the price and quality. He even ordered a second one. After lunch, we played a bit more then we left. The staff all had a smile, warm greeting and they all did it with a smile. In today’s hard economic times, it is easy to say staff is a dime a dozen and you can replace someone, however the staff here has extraordinary customer service skills and this cannot be taught. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea13
Reviews.Content: Gold Spike Weekends in Las Vegas can cost a fortune, most hotels triple their rates. Oasis at Gold Spike had decent room rates over a booking website. That's why I choose it and not all reviews had been too bad. First of all – this hotel is located 1 block from Fremont Street. But there are lots of homeless and suspicious people walking around day and night. They will try to talk to you, especially black people. I would not recommend the hotel for women travelling on their own. I did not feel safe anytime. Neither for my car. They got 2 parking lots, both are tiny compared to the number of rooms they offer. I have read reviews about finding it difficult to park here. I arrived early, so I did not have a problem. The next evening around 7 p.m. I got the last space. Driveway is small, it's complicated to turn with big cars. They do offer valet parking, but you have to leave your car right outside the side entrance directly on the turn right lane of the street... The casino is small but ok. Nice bar and food corner. Lots of security around. The girl at front desk went out of her way to satisfy my special room requests. I got a room on 4th floor (from 7) in the tower, which is no real tower, and it was far from the elevators. The room was having much noise from outside: big airconditioning 2 floors down for the casino. Big cinema complex on other side of smaller street, probably with noisy airconditioning too, lots of policesirenes during the evening. Never had got such a noisy outside like in this hotel. There is a lot of traffic during the evenings as well, as there are parking garages situated around the hotel and Fremont Street. They have an annex with motel-style room with outdoor entrance doors facing the pool. As the pool was seasonally closed, it might have been more quiet there. Sure it is not during warmer days when people are going to have pool parties... I was a bit nervous as I had read some bad reviews after booking (non-refundable). But the room was ok. A bit smaller than motel rooms (no 400 sqm as they promise on the internet). With a kingbed the room left some space to walk up and down. Furniture is cheap and has a modern touch. Surfaces are covered with glass to prevent furniture (no real wooden one) from scratches. Walls are partly done in turquoise colour, so this looks fresh and nice. I would say the rooms are basic. If they were located in a quiet surrounding it would have been a nice stay. Rate was under 50$. The bathroom was tiny but ok. It's all newly renovated. Just my toilet was leaking at the bottom, water on the floor, but maintenance fixed it very fast. Bathroom is tiled, with a nice tub and nice toiletries, more than just a soap bar. After maintenance had been to my room, housekeeping came again to have a look and they were very nice and gave me some more towels. There is no fridge or microwave in the room, even no closet, just a small wardrobe beside the bed to hang some clothes on it. It's ok for a short stay. No ironing equipment as well. And there is NO hairdryer! As you get no information about the hotel when checking in, I cannot say if they have a laundry or not. The kingbed was firm and good, nice blanket buth after all thin. Old fashioned airconditioning under the window. There is not enought bright light in the room. All in all one lamp at the entrance, one standing lamp beside the desk (does not give much light) and 1 on each side of the bed. Walls are thin and you will hear people talking or coughing. This place will never be my first choice again. If town's politicians just did something to make people feel safer in the area, this might be a good choice for people on low budget. But I know they are having problems with weird and poor people walking around Fremont street since decades and can't solve that problem. My friends, living in Henderson, whom I visited, told me that downtown is a nasty place. Last week someone got shot. It is known as extremely unsafe. I did not see it that bad but maybe I should think about it. My friend did not want me to go there for the 2nd night, but I had already prepaid (50,- incl at weekend) I can recommend this hotel only for people who are looking for a basic room and are not afraid of more dangerous parts of a town, Gold Spike is just average. I would not recommend it to my friends anyway.

Reviews.Title: “old school vegas,the way vegas should be.”
Reviews.Author: julie b
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let you know just stayed at the gold spike and loved it! Went to the golden nugget high roller suite (1 bedroom apt-spa suite)from there and actually missed the gold spike. Price, location and value is awesome. I’m kind of scared to tell others since then everyone will find out and there will be no availability. Clean rooms Friendly staff Cheap awesome food. Small enough that you feel comfortable to gamble.. Thx, Julie Barnes P.s.-I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Continuously Improving”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover999
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 day stay at the Gold Spike, and was generally satisfied with improvements since my last visit a year ago. Security to the rooms was improved with access-card requirement on elevators, and I also did not observe any vagrants hanging around outside the building or in the parking lot. Check-in was quick and efficient. My request for a specific room was honored, and the room was ready upon my arrival, spotless and all furnishings in excellent condition. Housekeeper services were very good, except one day when my room (and two others nearby) got "missed" when the regular lady had the day off. I waited over an hour for some towels to be sent up to the room. Had breakfast every day in the Coffee Shop ... excellent service, good food, reasonable prices!! The casino was nearly empty, but I had some good luck on the slots during my stay. Drink service was good. As mentioned by others, the machines don't issue a payoff ticket, so you have to wait for your winnings. (A minor inconvenience.) Parking continues to be a big problem, and to complicate matters, the lot was "closed" for two days so that a Halloween party could be held on the grounds. This forced registered guests to utilize a valet parking service. I simply cannot understand why management of this hotel refuses to ensure safe and convenient parking for hotel guests and patrons of their casino. Non-customers have the best spaces tied up while they wander Fremont Street Experience, particularly in the evenings If you are utilizing public transportation, the Gold Spike is a great choice . The bus stop is only a half-block away from the front door. Fremont Street is a one-block walk, with excellent casinos and restaurants. For visitors driving a car, there are better options. The El Cortez and Plaza have plenty of safe, secure parking available in their garages.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel of Downtown Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: BrianK23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Gold Spike several times over the summer...and I must admit that my expectations were definitely exceeded. The renovation they did gives the place a very modern, hip vibe. I stayed in both the Oasis rooms by the pool and rooms in the tower. Both are good. TV and channel selection are EXCELLENT...having stayed in several hotels in the area, this one is the best in terms of available channels to watch. The restaurant downstairs is GOOD! Quality food at good prices. The staff...especially Alex...are terrific. They remember my name each time I check in and even got an upgrade to a suite my last stay there. The suites are GREAT...I would definitely stay in one again. I plan on staying at Gold Spike again and would recommend it to someone who wants a nice room to stay in at a very affordable price!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, spacious and good location”
Reviews.Author: dean C
Reviews.Content: The goldspike was value for money, clean, quiet, comfortable, cool, spacious, modern rooms. Cable tv and Internet were great. The swimming pool was quite big, lots of seating, clean and relaxing.We didn't use the casino or restaurant so unfortunately we can not comment. The Gym was disappointing, very limited equipment all bar one machine was broken. We took the deuce to the strip, its about a 30 minute ride, so very accessible and a good cheap option away from the busy strip. There were lots of restaurants, cafes and shops close by. Staff lacked customer service skills, they weren't very friendly and didn't offer much information. I would stay here again but I would consider similar deals on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Small, unique hotel in downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: suetravels1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit - building is small and old. Parking limited but outside the door. Casino is also small. The renovated hotel rooms are very basic, clean and modern. Gold Spike is located about 2 blocks from the Fremont Experience. We like it but don't expect the Golden Nugget ! Ice is freely given at the bar in the casino - no other amenities such as room service, pool or fitness center

Reviews.Title: “Bikefest 2011, pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: gms208
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at end of September for Bikefest, nice little hotel for cheap. Pool area is best part of hotel, rooms are older but nicely appointed and recently remodeled. All in all for what theyre working with at this property they really do a nice job. Restaurant food was great, service was hit & miss depending on the server. Casino is small, no table games during the day and only 3 or 4 after dark but you're a close walk to Fremont St. Experience (1 block away) and all the larger casinos there. Been to Vegas many times but this is the 1st time we've stayed downtown and thoroughly enjoyed it. Would definitely recommend for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Crescenzi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Gold Spike early evening and check in was very quick and very helpful. We were given a pool room which was on the ground floor. The room was clean and newly refurbished, although it was missing a table to eat at (maybe the mess on the bed from the Chinese we made may have been a hint to them). Also, there were only blinds to shut out the light so was quite bright in the mornings. The rest of the room was fine, the room was cleaned daily and didn't have any other problems (well, maybe one... No haurdryer so had to dry my hair on the heater!! Lol). There is no ice machine for guest use so you have to go to the bar to get some.... Little warning, they make you feel a nuisance asking. They need more customer service in that department. The annoying part of Gold Spike was when playing the machines.. They don't pay out when you want to take your money. This is where you have to wait for someone to come over to you to give it to you in cash. Very annoying. We only gambled here a few times (very quiet). The location of the hotel is really close to Fremont and never once felt uncomfortable walking there and back. If you're looking for a good nosebag, the Chinese/Thai restaurant about 2 minute walk away is really tasty, good value and good size portions. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and is excellent value for money, even if you don't gamble there! (we gambled at Queens) :)

Reviews.Title: “bonnie sept gold spike hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: cricketkar
Reviews.Content: the location was the best part of staying here, we walked one block to fremont street. the rooms were clean, we had some issues with the housekeeping but you get what you pay for the casino is empty because an attendant has to pay you out after every machine, seems silly , food was great there.

Reviews.Title: “Lowroller suites”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: This place is the champagne of beers, fizzy but not too sweet. Your $8 resort fee gets you wifi and pool access, with a few decent coupons if you are lucky. The renovated rooms are a lucky shade of green with a nifty flatscreen, well worth $20 or so depending on the day. It's just one or two blocks to the main action of Fremont on a scruffy walk without any real danger. The rooms are very adequate, though not at all delux. Expect newer beds, decent A/C, a reworked bath, and Ikea like furnishings. The hallways and elevator are totally lowroller. The cafe offers a decent meal, so pluck out the coupon and enjoy. I like the tiny, but updated casino, cute. The bar is where the real action is for lowrollers looking for the highlife. Quirky but fun overall with a hidden oasis style pool. Well played GS.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights for $11 a night and it was generally a good hotel. The room was a nice size and was clean, the staff were helpful and they're the main basic needs I guess! The bad side to it was the disgusting air "freshener" that they pumped into the lift and the corridors which was overpowering and definitely not pleasant. Although luckily the smell didnt infect the rooms! The other bad side is that this appears to be the only casino in the area that plays music 24/7 from speakers on the outside of the building. We were on the first floor above the casino so this music woke me up at all hours. We also seemed to have a temperamental toilet which flushed continuously unless you pulled the handle up after pushing it, although to be fair we never reported this to get it fixed. It's not very far from the Fremont Street Experience which is excellent but if you're after the main strip expect a 1 hour bus journey on the duel bus which stops at every casino! Parking is free and although there's limited spaces once you park up you most likely wont move the car again and if there are no spaces you can leave the keys with the free valet. There is a 24 hour restaurant in the hotel with alright food and mostly helpful staff. All in all its not bad for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “It's All Good At Da' Spike!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GriswaldTrucksters
Reviews.Content: Booked an unbelievable deal through Travelocity for 3 nights.....usually stay on Fremont Street, decided to give this a go for the price and just a block or so from Fitzgerald's. We were not disappointed. Inside, the casino has been fully modernized as well as the rooms. The rooms were spotless with fresh paint.....beds large and comfortable. Shower hot with good pressure. Hey, I dont go to Vegas to sleep or chill in my room, so rumbling, bumbling, stumbling to my room post 2 or 3 am does not require a 5 star hotel. That being said the rooms were great. Front desk staff, Lisa Marie, was outstanding. We got there at 8am and asked if a room might be available...it wasnt, so she checked our bags. An hour later she was on the horn calling us with a room ready. This was after she found my phone number on my carry-on bag. Over the top. The "Sexy" Blackjack dealers lived up to their names. Very nice and fun to play cards with, but I can only play so long when I get a lousy hand and they continually turn over 21's and 20's. We didnt play BJ much because all three of us got slaughtered and their pit boss” (yes they actually had a pit boss), was an a-hole. Their site said they had roulette but there was not a table in sight. When we asked about roulette, Dick the PB scoffed at us and rolled his eyes. Would stay here again for a smokin' deal.Bartenders were pretty and nice....good place to watch football. Small book in the back. Would stay here again for a smokin' deal. Pool was really cool, didnt swim though. Prime Rib $5.99 Special was not very good. Veggies and tater were good but the meat was tough and undercooked....service was good. Seemed to be a few more vagrants around this corner than others. P.S. Stay away from Dick the Pit Boss.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable extended stay!”
Reviews.Author: Annette C
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive, relaxed, off strip, casino hotel to celebrate retirement and slow down from the work world. Wonderful friendly staff, great food (we often shared our large plates). Three dollar blackjack, heated pool, very clean, fantastic location. Rooms are spartan but adequate. Neon Boneyard and Pawn Shop (History Channel) in close walking distance. We would never go back to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: DeenaB1228
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in on 9/18/2011 and stayed through 9/23/2011. This hotel was great and the staff is very friendly. The cook in the cafe was awesome, he prepared my food just as I ordered it and he even liked to joke around. The room was clean and the A.C. worked wonderfully. We will definitely be staying here again, we are looking at March 2012 to stay here. The location is great for the Fremont Street Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Budget stay, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenvive
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed in Vegas on freemont street. The goldspike was value for money, very cheap. Clean, quiet, comfortable rooms. Good cable tv and Internet. Pool basic but clean and relaxing. We didn't use the casino or restaurant so cant comment. Gym was the only downfall, only 3 machines in the gym, only 1 of which worked, disappointing as website describes it as a state of the art gym. About 30 minute ride on deuce to main strip. Staff were the biggest let down;rude, unapproachable and seemed like they didn't want to be there.I would stay here again but I think there are just as good a deals on the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, But..........”
Reviews.Author: Goldvsmith
Reviews.Content: A no frills hotel, but a nice place to stay if you don't need right on the strip. Come on, $29 a night for a clean and quiet hotel with free parking. Hotel is located a safe one block walk to the downtown casinos and the awesome Fremont Street Experience. They have quaint little grill with a nice $5.99 prime rib dinner and nice breakfast. Friendly staff also.

Reviews.Title: “Students Saving Money...”
Reviews.Author: ThePoorStudent
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Gold spike for 5 days and choose this hotel after looking through reviews of many online. We took this one since we are students and wanted to save money. That's why seeing a 44.90$ fee on your account after coming home kinda kills it for you. I just don't like to be tricked or having people trying to trick me... and that's how I feel now. We used tripres.com and we payed it said taxes and fees included. You can find GOOD OFFERS if you BOOK IN ADVANCE and some of the ads actually do say "NO RESORT FEE". You can get show offers and other bonuses included in your booking there as well. Now for the 9$ extra per day for what they call "resort fee". (just plain stupid) I've read about it and it's supposed to be for gym etc. which in this case consisted of 3 different kinds of running machines on the 2nd floor. (never used them) I would rate this hotel "Very Good" without this fee and I would probably have come here again without considering trying a different hotel if it wasn't for this. Initially we got a room hidden in a corner "pool side" at the 1st floor (out of 2, poolside only). The room gave the impression of a renovated basement. The TV was to the left of the bed which felt extremely inconvenient and the room was rather small with a view at ground level over the parking lot. We immediatly asked if they had any rooms with the TV in front of the bed and Lise-Marie (receptionist) suggested "the tower" which is inside the casino. This room was MUCH spacier and had a TV in front of the bed. She said that she liked the tower rooms better herself and I could understand why. The crew at the casino is in general very nice and helpful just like I read earlier in reviews and this was also one of the main reasons that we picked this hotel. The room had: a long furniture piece covered with glass that had drawers with space for some clothes. (along the TV wall) 1 Chair 2 bedside tables with one drawer. 1 Telephone Cable-TV 1 Bible There were some nasty looking stains on the bathtub that looked like mold but I would like to believe that it's something else because otherwise it would have been removed a long time ago. Also the handle to the bathtub was a bit loose and since it was quite unique in the way you turned it on we encountered some problems with turning it on. So we asked for help and you're supposed to kinda hold the handle in place and then rotate it. You'll see for yourself... I guess poolside rooms would be a lot of fun if you're there friday to sunday since they have a lot of things going on during saturdays. It had rained the day we got to the hotel and there were water dripping everywhere around the pool area and I immediatly disliked that area. The pool is outside the casino and tower building and it's surrounded by the poolside rooms which consist of a 2story tall rectangular building. So the pool is separated from the "main" building. I read that the pool was supposed to be freezing, it was not. It could however be a little bit cleaner. It's located one block from Fremont street so it's easily accesible. The Strip (Las Vegas Boulevard) is quite a distance away but there is buses you can take on the corner of Fremont street. It's located on the same street as the Gold spike parking lot that is closest to Fremont street. Speaking of parking lots, there's one close to the pool area and entrance to the reception and then there is one diagonally across the casino building. Parking is free but it was always a lot of cars even if we always found a spot. When it comes to shows and entertainment I suggest you get a tourist magazine/s the day you arrive because you can save a lot of money on shows there. They also have these magazines on flights so if you're flying check out the magazines there as well. ALSO on Fremont street if you walk from the Gold spike towards the Golden nugget you will find a ticket selling area that sells discounted tickets that are shown on a TV just outside the entrance. Have a nice time in Vegas and GOOD LUCK! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: biglyd
Reviews.Content: I booked our room online as it was an unbelievable super saver rate. My girlfriend and I were really happy with the room, staff and services. The smaller size property is a refreshing change from the massive strip hotels. Property is in great shape and I love the designer's touches, especially the swimming pool area. Our room was in the area around the pool, and as other's write, simple and tasteful. Great place for mid-low budgets !

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Alliecat12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spike to save a bit of money and because besides the Nuggett it's one of the only hotels on Fremont with a pool. The little restaurant was really good and the video poker bar had great bartenders. We would stay there again but expect nice and simple. Also try the Cabana Suites at the El Cortez

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike, What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: ramblegamble77
Reviews.Content: No doubt about it, I like the Spike. Starting with the great rate (about $25) I found on www.goldspike.com, the Spike's online reservation process is simple. Next, early and easy check-in at the front desk with Alex -- he gets an A+ for customer service. For booking directly online, I got to Spin the Wheel for rewards (two free draft beers for me, but the wheel also had free rooms, free upgrades and other fun prizes). My room in the renovated Oasis was steps away from the great pool. The room was clean and and relaxing -- two thumbs up for the cozy chair, the comfy bed and the flat-screen TV. The casino was kind of quiet (but it was a weekday), yet still a fun place to drink (bartender makes an outstanding margarita) and play. I stayed at the Spike a few years ago before the renovation -- it is hardly the same place now. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “best value in town”
Reviews.Author: kingofpoker
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for the price & to see "old vegas" after a 5 star hotel on the strip. room was decent size & clean, entire staff was friendly & helpful, especially alex at the front desk. nice tv & pool. freemont street is a must see. plenty to do & see; get steak & lobster for the price of a burger on the strip. no poker room in casino, but a short walk to binions, where it all started. i'll definetly be back

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep but no more. Would not pay more than $38 (total cost).”
Reviews.Author: Chowmeister
Reviews.Content: The 'deluxe' room we received at the Oasis side of the property did not appear as advertised. VERY barebones for a deluxe room. There was no dresser with drawers, a desk, or any chairs to sit on. There were 2 queen-sized beds, one small table (with drawer) in between, a flat-screen Emerson LCD with a grainy image, midget-sized washroom, outside sink, and one bar and shelf for clothing etc. There was also a very cheap, and unworking, alarm clock. The pool, however, was clean and offered a welcome respite from the over 100 degree heat. It should also be mentioned that cleaning staff put minimal effort in cleaning our room on the last 4 days of our stay. To the hotel manager if you are reading this: we stayed in room # 226 on 31 AUG - 6 SEP 11 and our room was barely cleaned for the last 4 days of our stay. The sweat-infused bedsheets were unchanged, and the bed was poorly made. The bathroom was uncleaned and the floor was unvacuumed. A pile of garabge was unremoved from the room as well. Needless to say I left no tip for the maid. Another thing that should be mentioned about the property. Their restaurant is decent for diner fare. I recommend the Philly steak sandwich. The slots (if that's your thing) pay much better here than on the strip with the EL Cortez down the street being the best if you can mind stepping into an ash-tray-like atmosphere. The Palms, with a swanky atmosphere, is rated only slightly higher than the El Cortez for slots but is a ways off the strip. I recommend the $7 daily bus pass to get around if you plan on partying. I will return again IF I can share the cost with a friend, otherwise, I can get a MUCH better value renting a furnished apartrment by the week. At least I'd have somewhere to wash my clothes for no extra cost. I will conclude by saying I probably received one of the poorer rooms due to getting an el cheapo rate on Priceline rather than dealing direct with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Noon1
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about my stay at the Gold Spike but I have to admit I was pleasantly suprised. The staff is the nicest I have ever come across in Las Vegas and my husband and I usually vacation here twice a year. Everyone from the front desk to the housekeepers were all friendly. Don't worry about the location there is visible security here night and day and is just one block off the busy Fremont Street and that is lit up too. We were really impressed that you must have a room key to activate the elevator to go up! You don't even find that on the higher end hotels unless you are going to the suites. Rooms were spotless and the food is good at a great price! The pool is the best one of the nicest we have seen really pretty and the water is always cool. I usually pick hotels to try pools and this one did not disappoint! Plus they don't hassle you if you bring in your own drink. Hotel room floors are very quiet too in the tower. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: oldbuckhorn
Reviews.Content: People think this hotel is very down-scale but I loved it. The rooms have been re-done and I had a flat screen LCD TV, super comfortable bed, and a big bathtub to soak in after a hard day walking in Vegas. Their breakfasts are awesomely good and dirt cheap and the free drinks in the casino I think are the best I had in Vegas. A strawberry Daqueri with whipped cream - one after another - kept me at the slots endlessly and the short walks around downtown are so easy. Meeting Elvis and Kiss while having more free drinks is pretty nice. Forget the strip, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed to save money, in the end we didn't”
Reviews.Author: RobPitcherAUS
Reviews.Content: The Gold Spike wasn't a bad place to stay in downtown. The little restaurant had inexpensive food, which we took back to our room. The thing which bothered us, however, was that we got there around 7pm, to be told our room was sold to someone else. I had made a booking over a month earlier. She said the best she could do was CHARGE US to upgrade to a suite - a $50 surcharge. We were late to see Penn and Teller, so grudgingly agreed. Charging us for their own error was not pleasant. And if they have a policy of selling the rooms booked earlier (we needed two double beds, their were three of us) and disregarding those who made bookings, that is a terrible policy. For what we paid we could have had somewhere nicer and nearer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: cps37
Reviews.Content: We booked a pool view room. The view was of a wall near the pool so we asked to move and it was done in five minutes. Excellent service! The pool was clean and had a huge supply of towels. Loved it! Played $3 blackjack and the atmosphere in the casino was calm and peaceful. I liked Gold Spike and would recommend it. Fremont is the place to enjoy Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike Rocks and Alex at the front desk is AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: yoly18
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for my hubby's Birthday week. Upon checking We were given a a lottery style card to win a prize and we won a room upgrade to the SUITE!!! Our week was made as that was the best win we have ever had in Vegas, the suite was very roomy and comfortable. Alex at the front desk immediately made us feel at home, he was so professional and down to earth. The casino is fun and the slots are loose. Great drinks (thanks Heather the amazing bartender ) and the friendliest staff we have ever encountered in Las Vegas. The hotel is near the freemont street experience so everything is in walking distance. We loved the golden grill we ate most meals there, not only delicious but fast service and great prices, we will definately be coming back in Decemeber for my birthday week.. Thanks Alex and Gold Spike for an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike is a favorite in Las Vegas, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: BrianMoy
Reviews.Content: Myself and friend were visiting Las Vegas and I suggested we stay at the Gold Spike. I've rented there before and always a great experience. Its one of the "old Vegas" casino hotels from the Rat Pack days, yet its been remodeled and clean. Some of the old historic casinos I have stayed at are cheap, but pretty run down. The rooms I've stayed at are always nice. I call it Space Age modern. The color scheme is white, brown and kind of a swiming pool blue. Cool frame around the widescreen TV. The design is very classic and clean, but updated with an Ipod speaker. Very geometric and I like it. Me and my friend liked the room so much, we took some fun pictures. The rooms I've stayed at come with 2 small bottles of water, which is nice being the desert. I first stayed there because a friend of mine from Sacramento always stays there when he is in Vegas and I kept coming back. I have met Christina at the front desk and Billy security guy and they remember me each time I come and we talk. They have always been nice and treated me well. The bar has really cheap prices so its a nice place to come. The restaurant is also super cheap and good quality for the prices. They have a prime rib special which I like to get. I think I've eaten there every time I've stayed. And its open 24 hours. I've gotten the same waitress and she remembers me also, which is so nice, I should know her name but I don't. So anyways, clean, excellent prices, very cool style, friendly folksy staff that remember me. And its walking distance from Fremont Street and cool bars down there. Yeah its everything I like.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel 'Motel Style' in the old town !”
Reviews.Author: Siestica
Reviews.Content: This place is well located, close to Freemont, it's not expensive, and staff is friendly and welcoming. Everything is clean, the breakfast (especially the pancakes) is delicious, this is a small hotel when you can feel comfortable, and the swimming pool with palms hepls to really enjoy your stay. Really good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on a good location.”
Reviews.Author: reiziger1992
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there 15 days in July so I had plenty of time to familiarize myself with the hotel. Pre-stay service was great since I am only 19 years old but they still allowed me to stay. I paid 600 dollars. The hotel has a really good location just a minute walk of Fremont Street and nearby attractions. Yet it is very quiet. The hotel has a nice, tasteful and well maintained exterior. It is very obvious that the building had a major make-over not so long ago. The interiors are modern and fresh. Check-in was quick and helpful. One thing I can't understand is why they didn't renovate the elevators. They look very worn and they smell bad. The room was nicely sized with modern decor and a comfortable bed. If you're staying on the second floor like I did you will have a spectacular view of the air conditioning. I didn't mind but I know some people do, Be also aware that you have to switch your airco off to get some sleep (noise). What I noticed was that my room (216) had no ipod-dock like advertised. I didn't care since I don't have an Ipod but it could be a major disappointment for someone who was counting on it. Bathroom was small of course but easy to use. Huge television was a big plus and is hard to find in this price-category. Cleanness was good but not great since I found some hairs that weren't mine in the corners of the bathroom and in the drain of the shower. You get shampoo and lotion BTW. Bring your own shower gel. Staff was friendly most of the times and very helpful. What I didn't like was that the maids begin cleaning at 9 am. Make sure you use the "Do no disturb" sign or they will wake you. The on site restaurant Golden grill is simply great with very very friendly staff and very delicious great priced food. Even if you don't stay at the hotel make sure you bring a visit to it. On site pool is great too, of course fairly small but it's a small hotel so the amount of water just seems to be right. It truly deserves it's name "oasis". Probably the best pool downtown after the golden nugget. BTW if you want to book an Oasis room ask if there are some pool partys... For obvious reasons. I was not allowed to gamble of course but the casino consists of less than a hundred slots and four Blackjack Tables with 3 dollar shoe Blackjack and the horrible 6-5 5 dollar single deck BJ. If you're serious about gaming take the 2 minute walk to the El Cortez where they pitch 3 dollar double and 5 dollar single deck games that pay 3-2 and have an 0.45% and 0.3% House Edge. Best Blackjack in Vegas. 3 dollar craps, full pay video poker and 5 dollar baccarat are also present. Of course they don't have dealers that look like hookers. This review sounds maybe a bit negative but I would like to point out that I really enjoyed my stay and I am trying to point out the flaws that other travelers might find important. The Strengths of the Gold Spike are the location, value, the staff, modern decor and the pool. If you're on a budget, don't want to gamble on your accommodation but you´re willing to gamble elsewhere, then the Gold Spike is for you.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION CLOSE TO FREMONT AREA”
Reviews.Author: carcars2002
Reviews.Content: This is the place if you are going to visit fremont experience. The staff is very courteous and helpful and the casino is very cozy and quiet. Especially liked the cleaniness of the rooms. Great atmosphere if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: bbihler
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty good place considering the price. My room above the casino was clean and comfortable, but as reported by others there's no ice machine (go to the bar to get ice, kind of odd, but hey when I needed ice they were 'Johnny on the spot' in getting me ice), no small fridge, and no coffee pot. Wi-fi was pretty slow so I ended up using my cell phone's hot spot feature. Bottom line in terms of the room, you get a bed, work area, set of drawers, flat screen TV, moderate sized bath, and kind of a view.....and its clean. Positives at the Gold Spike: - The staff - The food specials (hey the cafe/restaurant ain't all that, but less than $20 for a full prime rib dinner with salad and two glasses of wine) - Its a relaxed club, and guess what the bar keeps can actually make a darn good martini - Free parking - Close to Fremont St Negatives at the Gold Spike: - The ice thing - No fridge or coffee maker in the room - Slow, slow wi-fi - No business services (though you are close to business downtown where one can get copy, print, fax, etc services) Overall, I will definitely consider The Gold Spike for my next visit (btw, I travel to LV approx 8-10 times / year for personal business)

Reviews.Title: “Decent "Old Vegas" hotel & casino. Price is right!”
Reviews.Author: Jedi-Elvis
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all. Very accomodating (had to change rooms due to a sjhower problem). We stayed in the recently renovated Travel Lodge/Inn conversion by the pool. No elevator for 2nd floor (not a BD for me, just FYI). PITA getting a cab around there, a little dark at night, but close to "The Experience". Would return again for <$70/night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Alan2671
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually come to Las Vegas once a year and stay in a condo around the strip area. This was a last minute trip and we needed to stay in a hotel. We enjoy the Freemont Street area so we decided to stay the week downtown. We got a great air/hotel package online with the hotel portion being at the Gold Spike. We had walked past this hotel 2 years ago before the renovation and we were skeptical to say the least. We had some flight issues and did not make it to the hotel until about 3:30 in the morning, but check in went very smooth. My wife had foot surgery before we left and had problems negotiating stairs and when we checked in we were put into the second building on the third floor. We found out quickly that the elevator was not working which was a small problem. The next morning, I went to the front desk and talked to Alex about changing rooms. He had us in a different room within 20 minutes (well before check out time). I have to say that everything we asked the front desk for they took care of very quickly. The food in the diner was good for price and we ate most meals there. The casino was a little small as we do not play many slots, but it was good for a late night fix. We did not encounter vagrants as referenced in previous reviews. We did see the same 2 homeless people on the street going to Freemont Street every day, but were never approached and we felt perfectly safe. Over all we had a good time and were very impressed with the Gold Spike. When we go back to Vegas and if we need a hotel, we will definitely consider stayin here again.

Reviews.Title: “great time for a great value”
Reviews.Author: dizzydancer80
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write a review, but I give credit where it's due. Before stepping foot in the Gold Spike I didn't have very high expectations, what could I expect for such cheap rates? To my surprise I walked in and was amazed by how great the place looked. I then proceeded to check in, and just my luck I 'm stuck behind some guy complaining about who knows what. He was rude and very obnoxious and insisted on yelling at the unfortunate person at the registration desk. Out walks the manager and just in a matter of moments she diffuses the situation without missing a beat. The man walks away satisfied and even cracks a smile. Then It was our turn to check in and of course it was the same manager (Briana) checking me in. All I could think to myself was "great, she's probally bitter from the last customer" which was not the case at all. In fact she was extremely polite and very friendly. Nothing less than awesome. Check in was quick and painless, she even had me interested planning another trip to Las Vegas before even handing me the keys to my room. We headed up to the room and WOW! It looked exactly like the pictures online and the room was cute, cozy and very clean. After dropping our bags off we headed back down stairs find some food, since we had driven non-stop from cali. Ended up just grabbing a table at the grill in the hotel and all though the wait was rather long the food was delicious and the prices more than fair. Customer service in the entire hotel is flawless. As a flight Attendant I travel for a living and am no stranger to a hotel. Overall one of the best experiences I've ever had staying in a hotel. I've already started planning my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Alogfortheride
Reviews.Content: We got what we paid for. A 3rd floor corner room with a very firm bed & tv. The room was clean & neat, but there was only one wastebasket, no frig, no blow dryer, no ice bucket, no ice or vending machines, and a toilet that took a minimum of 10 flushes to get the water to move. The towels smelled like dirty ashtrays and the blinds did nothing to keep the neon lights from illuminating the whole room. Several times during the night, we were awakened by what sounded like dumpsters being dropped to the ground...from the roof. We asked for extra pillows & were told they didn't have any extras, but could get us some the next morning (for what, the ride home?). The bartender treated us as if we were bothering him, and that was when we could get his attention, even though he was only a couple feet from us & had only one other customer. We decided to try the $5.99 Prime Rib special in the Grill (looks like a small hospital cafeteria). We were told by the waitress that we could not have the table by the door because it was reserved for the owner & were seated at a table so small, you could hardly move your elbows. Not five minutes later, several young tattoo'd tourists came in & sat themselves at the table & were not moved. We are not weird, smelly or rude, so I don't know why we were treated so badly. Prime rib gristle, canned corn, hard potato. The dealers and cashiers in the casino, on the other hand, were absolutely wonderful. Resort fees....really?

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: SteveC5757
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, and friendly and for value I can't find any other stay in Vegas that comes close! Just 1 block from Freemont St and being on Las Vegas Blvd, the 24 hour public bus route to the strip is right outside the door (purchase a 24 hour ticket for as many rides as you want all day). Alex at the front desk, is a great example of all the staff nothing was too much trouble (I had to keep altering my departure date) he really made you know he wanted to assist in anyway he could, I would say the same for all the staff. My only critque would be the internet speed, but it is free so it is hard to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk worker Alex, Is a big help.”
Reviews.Author: Stacey1990
Reviews.Content: Love the time and stay. Everything is great! Front desk worker Alex is a big help and a nice guy. Rooms are great and awesome.. I will stay here more thank you gold spike and alex Stacey Lavergne

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great value!”
Reviews.Author: northfork02
Reviews.Content: I won't write a long review as I usually never do reviews for places. But i'll have to say this place is great, we checked in 2 days after Memorial Day weekend and spent 2 nights here. Check in was great, had a very nice and polite ladie that checked us in. Our room was right next to the pool, so was very convienent. The room was very nice and bright. Furniture and bed are very sweet. Excellent job on the remodel of the entire place. Pool was great as we went swimming both days and had the pool to ourselves at 4:00 in the afternoon. The casino was perfect for us, very small and easy to navigate. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and the food was very good and our waitress was very friendly.This place has some of the best customer service i've seen in a long time. Everyone was so helpful and very attenitive.The location is great, only 1 block to Fremont St. We will stay here again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel for budget minded travelers”
Reviews.Author: Starfruit1479
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I decided to take a trip to Vegas without booking a hotel on a busy holiday weekend. Bad Idea,NOT! after looking for vacancy on almost all budget hotels off the strip and old town Vegas, we were about to give up, as we were driving the old town streets we stumbled across this hotel, we asked if there were any vacancy and fortunately for us there were, even as it was a holiday weekend the rates were not costly we decided to stay an extra night. The staff was very nice and helpful, we forgot our bathing suits so they gave us directions to the closest outlets. The hotels has been recently renovated, our room still smelled like new furniture. Very clean, comfortable beds, and the pool was so refreshing! Definitely not a five star hotel but for travelers that are budget conscious it is worth to give it try, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be sorry you stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: LeftieLuci
Reviews.Content: The Gold Spike is NOT a five star hotel, it doesn't pretend to be, but for the price you cannot beat it. ($17 a night! on kayak.com...but I was told that if you book through the hotel directly they will match your internet deal...I suggest you do this. I didn't and lost out on being given a scratch off which include room upgrades...I learned this from another guest in the elevator and it was confirmed at the front desk.) I fell in love with the Gold Spike. I found my place to stay in Vegas. The rooms are recently renovated, the location isn't half bad, only a short block from the action on Fremont. The rooms were impeccably clean and the staff...all of them, were great. I read the reviews on yelp.com and here, I researched this place to within an inch of it's life because some of the reviews are a little sketchy. I stayed there for a week let me give you the honest truth. Vagrants? What vagrants? In some of the reviews it claims that the parking lots are crawling with bums all the time and it's in an unsafe neighborhood. FALSE!! I felt perfectly comfortable walking out into the parking lots at all hours and walking the block to Fremont by myself. For many nights I didn't encounter any vagrants. I did run into one, he gave me quite the sob story, he should have won an Oscar. I informed security about it and they took care of it right away. But I have stayed at other hotels downtown and that really is nothing out of the norm. Valet and parking. This hotel doesn't have a valet except on weekends. I didn't use it because there are two parking lots, one on Ogden and Las Vegas Blvd and one on 4th Street. They are both right next to the hotel. Using the valet just seemed really lazy. I was a little concerned about the parking situation, but I never had a problem finding a spot. Both parking lots look tiny, but there was always at least a space or someone leaving. Casino. It is very small, but it's a small hotel. It has everything you need. A bar, a little restaurant, security, slots, black jack (and the dealers are skimpily clad cuties that my boyfriend really enjoyed looking at!) Not to mention impeccably clean. It's very nice in there, with a modern, trendy feel, not a cheap, cheesy "Old Vegas" feel. Rooms. The rooms are not huge, but they aren't cramped either. They look just like the pictures on the internet. The water pressure is terrible though, but again, I find that in every hotel I have stayed in in Vegas. The beds are comfortable, the TV reception is not so great I find. I had a problem figuring out the alarm clock on the iPod docking station, I suggest bringing your own but maybe you are smarter than I am. There aren't enough hangers, only five, but there are lots of drawers and places to stash your things during your stay. The bathroom isn't huge and it's kind of weird that the bathtubs are on a higher level once you step into them, be careful stepping out of them after a shower because I am going to say that the floor is a good three inches lower than the inside of the tub and can be surprising. Huge downside is there are no refrigerators in the rooms and no ice machines you have to go to the bar with the white bucket provided for you if you want ice. There is only ONE outlet in the room as well and one in the bathroom. So with two laptops that needed charging and two phones. two iPods and a camera battery, my boyfriend and I had to decide what we needed to charge. Staff. I can't say one single bad thing about any of them. Alex who works the front desk, I spoke to him on the phone several times before my stay, I have to say is very accommodating and an asset to this hotel for sure. The manager did a good job hiring that one. He was extremely helpful during my entire stay. (I did have to switch rooms, due to a previous guest doing something unsavory to the commode resulting in a godawful smell every time the toilet was flushed and we couldn't take it anymore, they didn't question me, they apologized, and assigned me a new room right away.) I called ahead and spoke with Alex and requested not to be pool side, as high up as possible (fifth floor) with two queens, he made sure I got my way. My check in was with Lisa (Lisa Marie? I can't remember her name.) Anyway both check in and check out were lickety split fast. The security guys were always very friendly, saying hi and thank you goes a long way. They grab your ice for you when the bartender is busy. Any concerns you have, you can count on them to take care of the problem. Lastly, I want to compliment the housekeeping staff on the fifth floor. They were all very nice. They are people, not just maids remember to tip and again, saying hi and asking how they are doing is going to go a long way. They asked me which room I was in and if I would like housekeeping service, by the end of the week, they knew which room I was in, they asked me if I was having fun, if I was enjoying my stay. I am not sure if they do this with everyone, but they made me feel really welcome. I made it a point if I was walking past one to say hi, these ladies don't have an easy job, they have to deal with some pretty gross things on a daily basis I am sure, it is Vegas after all. Saying hi and acknowledging them makes their job a little more enjoyable probably. When I left, the three that were working all said goodbye to me, told me to have a safe flight and hoped I had fun. I felt like it was really genuine. When the housekeeping staff makes you feel welcome and goes out of their way, you know the hotel did something right by hiring really awesome individuals. Pool: I didn't go to the pool so i didn't get to sport my lucky bikini, but I did take a picture of it, it's open from 8am to 10pm, so basically you can swim anytime. It's private so no one is spying on you and it looks NICE. Not skeevy and gross at all. It looks exactly like the pictures on the internet. Location: It is right on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Ogden. It's just a couple of blocks from the freeway and only a block walk to Fremont...close enough to the action, but far away for it to be quiet. It's easy to get to with entrances on Las Vegas Blvd, Ogden and 4th street. Walgreens is right on Fremont for items that you left behind. The parking lots are easy to exit too. I know this was a long review, I hope it was helpful and convinced you to stay at the Gold Spike. You will get individualized attention and feel like a VIP, something the resorts on the strips cannot offer. You will get to know the names of the people who work there, it's not different faces every day, it's the same people offering great customer service. It's a small hotel, there is no shopping, you can navigate the casino with ease, you can see the doors from the elevator bank. It's clean, it's not run down and shabby. My boyfriend and I both agree, we will be staying here again. The value for our room can't be beat. I brag about this place, I can't guarantee you will get the price I did on the internet, but even for the advertised $39.99 a day...it's still a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable, it's like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: OroCarson
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Gold Spike. We have been there several times before, but not since the renovation and remodeling was completed. We stayed in the "old tower" but there was nothing old about it. The room was completely refurbished; colorful new paint and carpeting, big screen TV, extremely comfortable king size bed and pillows, new bath fixtures. Housekeeping service was great and dependable; we had a complete set of new towels every day. The restaurant is open 24 hours a day and we very much enjoyed their $5.99 prime rib special! The servers were polite, personable, and professional, and remembered us from previous visits. The room rates can't be beat! We will DEFINITELY return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “They're trying hard, yes. But they can still try harder.”
Reviews.Author: NYYNO1
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on Saturday night at the very end of my week-long solo trip. The obvious reason I selected GS was they were the cheapest. It was a little over $60 and the total came about $90 with tax and the resort fee together. I didn't like it since they kinda trick you with how they calculate their room tax. They give you a room for $60, which they call it a discount rate. Then they tell you the actual room rate was $120, so they would still calculate the tax off the actual room rate. On top of that they charge you a resort fee. So before you know, the price balloons to $90. It was still cheap compared to other hotels on weekends, but the point is they are sneaky and I just don't like sneaky people. Anyway, I booked Oasis room, which is really an old motel that was purchased and renovated by GS a year ago. To their credit, they REALLY cleaned up the place. The room was obviously very small, and the layout of the room reminds me of a typical sleazy motel. But the room was newly painted and very clean. The biggest surprise was the bed. I had a king bed but it was VERY comfortable. The pillow was just the right size and firm yet soft enough for comfort. I give this room a very high mark, considering that this used to be a dirty old motel. They really did a good job, I thought. The pool had a nice layout, but I was disappointed that it was not heated. The water was ICE COLD to the point that it was very uncomfortable. Another minus was they don't have a hot tub either. Also, if you stay in Oasis room in the pool season, one downside is that it would get very loud from the people splashing around in the pool as it is right outside Oasis rooms, and all Oasis rooms are directly facing the pool. On top of that, they had a band started playing by the pool while I was there, so the music was blasting through my door all night. Needless to say, I left the room and stayed away until they finally stopped playing around midnight. So when you book an Oasis room, just make sure to ask the hotel if they have any pool party scheduled during your stay. In my case they didn't tell me in advance, which I thought was a lack of courtesy on their part. Did I have to pay the resort fee just so that they could blast loud music that nobody was really listening to until very late at night? The casino at GS is so small I wouldn't even call it a casino. It's mostly just a few rows of slots. They do have few Blackjack tables, but they are closed most of the time. When they were open, the tables were crowded. Another minus for the GS casino; they hand pay. It's not like I'm a busiest man in the world, but I would hate to have to wait 15 minutes for a cashier person to bring me my $2.50 winning from a penny slot. A major bummer. So I spent all night playing at El Cortez across the street instead. Golden Grille, a 24hr diner at GS, was surprisingly good, especially their $5.99 steak dinner after 11:00 pm special was awesome. No, it's not a fancy four-star feast, but the steak was nicely done, just the way I wanted, and the service was very good as well, with a friendly chef and a cheerful waitress girl. Overall, my stay at GS was a mixed bag, unfortunately. I'd give high points for how they really cleaned up the place as a whole. But I must take few points off for some of the flaws, like how they charge you the hotel fees, the pool not heated, a noisy party without informing the guests, and the depressed casino situation. Still, for an average of $20 - $30/night they're charging for weekdays, I'd say it maybe worth it. But paying $90 for a noisy weekend night at Oasis motel? I must say you'd be better off staying somewhere else down the street. In any case, they should really rethink about the room charge structure, if they wish to get a consistent stream of return businesses. I'd stay again, sure, but strictly on weeknights and not in a pool season.

Reviews.Title: “Loving the spike”
Reviews.Author: Jasperw
Reviews.Content: The location is great: downtown. The prices are very cheap. The Wifi is free. The bed is huge and comfy. The water is hot. I was there 10 nights...and i loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LanderMagic
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Spike. The remodeled room was great and the staff was excellent. Didn't try out the pool, but plan to next time. We will be back. Michael Swain and staff at front desk were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “on my way back”
Reviews.Author: johnny1181
Reviews.Content: i was turned onto the gold spike last year while i was at the golden nugget, i cant wait to play and eat there again. the staff was so friendly and the food was awesome. the BJ dealers were some of the most friendly dealers ive met in my trips to vegas....here i come gold spike see you this weekend, johnny m seattle washington

Reviews.Title: “If You Want Value This Is The Place”
Reviews.Author: cigarman25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had decided at the last minute to go into Vegas a day early so we were just looking for somewhere inexpensive to spend the night. After checking various rates and reviews we decided on the Gold Spike. Located a block from Fremont Street the hotel offered updated and clean accommodations. We booked a pool room and is was a bit small but worked. Because people that are traveling with children book these rooms it is a bit loud so if you want peace and quiet stay in the main hotel.
