The casino is small and seemed like it was more locals there than tourists. The cafe has inexpensive meals and they are of good quality. Bottom line this Casino hotel is a good value and I would recommend it to people who are not fussy about there lodging but just want something clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service, 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: HavasuFan
Reviews.Content: We made reservations from our phone on hotels.com while driving through Primm. We got 2 confirmation emails from hotels.com so we called them to get one of them refunded. They talked to Alex (i think) at the front desk and he agreed to cancel one of the reservations without charging us any fees. When we arrived we found him to be very helpful. The place looks like a dive from the outside with vallet on the street, the inside of the small casino was clean and there were just a few people there at the bar. The carpet in the hotel hallway was hideous orange. Very skeptical of the room we opened the door and were very pleased with the inside of the room. It was very modern looking with fresh paint and a clean bathroom. Somehow my daughter lost her phone in the room even though we do a thorough walkthrough before leaving. (must've been inside the pillow case or something) I called and housekeeping found the phone and turned it in. Mike the General Manager took the time to take it to the post office and mailed it back to me. Thanks Mike!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to people that want to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “"Modern and Wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: skidapowda
Reviews.Content: Stay here. A short walk from Vegas strip. Room was great from this traveling college grad on a trip! Great place. Casino dingy, but rooms were great!

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: amaoricangirl66
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful this property was. The location was right off the highway and one block from "Freemont St." I checked in at 1pm and it was not a problem at all. The parking lot is tight but I love walking from my car and 60 feet later I'm resting in my clean, simply appointed room. The hotel has a wonderful vintage vibe to it from the colors of the room to the comfortable armless chair. The beds were great, bathrooms were clean, plenty of space for luggage and I felt safe. I was traveling with my teenage son and two girlfriends and we all loved it here. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant and the gals were great! The food tasted wonderful and for two people our meal was under $10. You can't beat that! Will we stay here again? Absolutely. I'd gladly give up going through casino's, long hallways, lines and lines of people waiting to check in anyday for this cute little place.

Reviews.Title: “A Golden Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lostavion
Reviews.Content: For a smaller hotel in downtown Las Vegas, The Gold spike perfect for a small family vacation with a tighter budget. The rooms were as clean and comfortable as any of the larger hotels on the strip. It's location is perfect. The Fremont Street Experience is close enough to walk to, but far enough away that the noise does not reach the hotel. All-in-all, after staying in several different hotels on several trips to Las Vegas over the years, The Gold Spike has definitely been the best.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled Hotel, Best Stay Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: wendyjoey
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gold Spike was awesome! We were very pleasantly surprised by this remodeled boutique hotel/casino. We stayed in a suite on the 7th floor which had a king bed, a white leather sofa, flat screen tv and balcony. The bathroom was all new modern tile, not the little white tiles like you see in the photos on this site. Although the room was small, everything was updated, we even had free bottles of water and an ipod dock. Its walking distance to the attractions on Freemont Street and we walked back to the hotel at 3am and felt completely safe. We are locals who enjoy going downtown for the fun bars/lounges and occasionally we stay downtown instead of taking a taxi home. If you've never been, there are quite a few bars within walking distance of each other that are super fun and offer a more mellow experience than nightclubs. We will definately be back! ps- the hotel cafe has a great breakfast at a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “The bossy spike!”
Reviews.Author: bossytrips
Reviews.Content: Got there...cheap, nice and clean. Pool was fresh.. just wish they had a hot tub... "the golden grill" was pretty good and very reasonable.(I don't recommend the prime rib it was cold). Didn't spend much time there. Only about a 5 minute drive to the strip. The grill is opened 24/7! So if u got some late night munchies its the place to go. The room was exact down to the picture on the wall. The bathrooms could be a little bigger. Good stay and cheap.. was expecting a lot worse. Never was approached by bums. Will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh for a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: paul611
Reviews.Content: Strange how one thing can ruin a stay. First the good points. Excellent value, able to get a meal any time day or night, room comfortable and clean, free parking. So what was the problem? Noise, noise from the plumbing, noise from the lift, noise which went on all night. My advice, don't take a room anywhere near the lift shaft!

Reviews.Title: “Livin' Large at the Spike”
Reviews.Author: JPipestone
Reviews.Content: We are regulars at The Spike. It's got everything you need and at a great price. It's a bit of old Vegas, a little sleazy, some questionable but harmless characters, and you don't have to walk a mile to the elevators or your car. How many slot machines do you need anyway? And the waitress remembers you at breakfast (Hon)! Especially nice since they renovated.

Reviews.Title: “This place exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: _WakingUpInVegas_28
Reviews.Content: I had read that the hotel had recently been renovated, so for the price I decided to set aside my skepticism and take a gamble on the Gold Spike. Turns out, it was a great call! In addition to the amazing price, the rooms were nice and clean and the staff was incredibly friendly. They have blackjack tables with very attractive young dealers and the table manager was helping us newbies with strategies. All in all, we had a great time at the Gold Spike and will definitely be staying there for our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, cheap & clean”
Reviews.Author: itropicbird
Reviews.Content: This looks like an old forgotten hotel that has been completely cleaned up. The outside still looks square, bricky and outdated, and you have to walk to the back of the small casino in order to find the check-in desk. But the outside is clean and well-manicured. There is a choice of rooms in the "tower" (main building, with elevator), or around the pool (more motel-like, with stairs). We were with a large group, and according to one in our group, they gave away her non-smoking room even though it was prepaid, so all that was left was a smoking room when she checked in. The rooms around the pool area were almost exactly the same, right down to the picture hanging on the wall. It was pretty bare, but very, very clean. No desk or chair or dresser, so our belongings landed up all over the floor or spilling off the one tiny wall-mounted bedstand. There was one tiny 9"x12" table with a lamp in the corner, and a wall-mounted flat screen TV. There was also a shortage of horizontal space in the bathroom, nowhere to set my curling iron or makeup or contact lens stuff, and no towel hooks. Part of the towel rack fell apart when I used it. I really have to commend the place though for taking what looked like a previously seedy downtown hotel and making it clean & economical. The shower had a curved shower curtain rod for more room, the towels were bright white, and the beds were comfy. And again, very clean. The didn't advertise it, but there was free Wi-Fi in the room, painless to access and very fast. The air conditioner was noisy so we left it off & it got a little toasty in the room, and there was moderate street noise & sirens on and off. The "fitness center" was a small room with an elliptical, a treadmill, and an older stationary bike. There's a restaurant on site that i didn't try but heard was pretty good. It's a convenient 2-block walk to Fremont Street with the larger casinos, and restaurants, bright lights & loud music, shops, street vendors and bizarre street characters. On the way we passed a few homeless people asleep in doorways. There's a big metal security wall around the rooms by the pool, and there are two small parking lots that fill up quickly. If you can't find a space, don't park in the structure as you will pay a fortune in meter fees. The hotel has free valet parking, you just might have to wait a bit for it. Overall although the area might be a bit questionable, the hotel was secure. You can't beat the price, and we've paid more for worse places to stay. Just be prepared for bare minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but you also get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Duster70
Reviews.Content: We experienced many problems but I guess some were to be expected for such a low room rate. The staff was friendly and tried hard but they are working with a lot of old equipment, old buildings, and failing technology. I paid for the upgraded "Oasis Pool King" room and my friends got the "18 Karat King" room. My room was more expensive but much smaller, and much less useable. The pictures for the "Oasis Pool King" room are inaccurate at best. My room had no table or anywhere whatsoever in the room to set anything. It was so small that it had a king bed (that was comfortable), a chair and a sink. Cell phones were charged on the floor, laptop had to be used on the bed. Keys or anything else had to be put on the chair. Very small, very poorly designed yet it is advertised as "Deluxe" and costs more! We tried at the front desk to change our room but were told that all of the "Oasis Pool" Rooms were the same size. The truth is it is a seperate, small hotel from the original property that was merged into the bigger one. It does have a pool, but the only elevator did not work, the internet was out 3 of the 5 days I was there, and the maid insisted we open the door one morning when she showed our room as empty on her list (when we were there on day 3 of 5)! The casino is decent but with no ticket payoff from the machines, waiting for a hand pay each time is very frustrating. We ate once at the cafe, it was decent and reasonable. There are homeless people in the area but I would have to say the Security is very adequate there. It is 1 block from the end of Fremont street which we walked to each night. We were usually with 3 other people and never had any problems or felt afraid. My advice, if you stay there, make sure you stay in the main tower, not the "Oasis Pool Rooms", dont count on the internet working all the time, dont expect too much, and if you need more than 1 pillow, bring your own. I have told friends about Gold Spike, but I have to temper their expectations with all the caveat's. My belief is that the facilities need more work to be reliable so the employees are not having to constantly apologize for problems or equipment breaking down. Overall, I would say the property is worth $25-$30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and easy”
Reviews.Author: ozcl
Reviews.Content: I travelled here by myself in Feb 2011. After reading other reviews I pretty much knew what I was getting into. For the price this place is still good value. The main things to be aware of are you are a fair distance from the main strip area and will need to catch a bus/taxi which takes a bit of time if you want to get to the main area. As other reviews mention there are a few shady characters in the area, I wouldn't recommend that woman wander around the area late at night by themselves. The hotel itself was fine for the price, although my room didn't get made up any of the days I was there and it had a bit of a funky/smokey smell to it even though it was a non-smoking floor.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike.....Maybe Best Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bill83873
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a super cheap newly remodeled hotel in Downtown Las Vegas stay at the 'spike". The rooms have all been rebuilt and my room rate over the internet was $27 a night including a Friday. The casino isnt much with a few $3 minimum blackjack tables and a very large bar.The location is one block of Fremont Street but there is plenty of security so I didnt worry and i had no trouble. The room had a flat screen TV and was clean. Bathroom was tiny but for $27 I was real happy.Probably not the best choice for kids but i will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: missrican
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for the new remodeled Gold Spike i was kind of wiery about staying her but my husband and our friends were planning a last minute trip for superbowl weekend. After speaking with the Manger Micheal he was very kind and convienced me into booking the rooms the rooms were very clean and look just like the pictures. the only bad expierence i had at this hotel is you have to pay a deposit and i paid that in cash and my debit card was charged for it as well so now i have to wait for that to be credited back which is alittle of an inconvienence. other than that upon our check in at 2 am the gentlemen at the front desk was very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Watchout for theft!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jusbryguy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the gold spike. I was a bit leery about staying there but, weighing the $12 room rate, I decided to give them a try. We took a drive around the building first only to find that there was no covered parking. You have to hope that you don't get harassed by one of the many "beggars" surrounding the area as you walk to the hotel after parking. I was quite impressed with the recently done renovation. Inside was very clean and nicely remodeled. The room was a bit small but comfortable. My friend and I decided to stroll down to the Cal. We left the do not disturb sign up (so the maid wouldn't enter) and left for a few hours. Upon arrival back to our room, we noticed the the do not disturb sign was removed. We entered to find the room cleaned and a carton of cigarettes missing. We notified management only to have him tell us that his maid said she didn't take anything (duh) and that perhaps I misplaced them. I can't believe that the "manager" actually was accusing me for losing them! I left a written statement with "Mike the manager" and still haven't heard any response from him. Simply said, if you're looking for a place to stay and you aren't carrying any valuables, stay at the Spike! It's hard to find good workers nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly, welcoming, clean, amazing hotel in Vegas! 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: sabandemirbasa
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone, Just got back from Vegas for the CES convention and stayed at the Gold Spike Hotel and Casino - what a great hotel!! The hotel was clean, great rooms and facilities, the staff were very professional, the rate was very affordable, quiet (great nights sleep), safe, friendly and just everything about this hotel was fantastic. I am the CEO of a technology company based in London, UK and stayed with my CTO and normally we would stay at one of the big 5 star hotels costing a fortune but decided to give the Gold Spike a go and we were NOT disappointed in a great location - you have to give this hotel a go. We will be staying here from now on for all our Vegas trips. I would like to take this opportunity to thank the staff and Mike the manager at Gold Spike Hotel and Casino for a very warm welcome and making our trip and stay in Vegas wonderful - thank you! Saban Demirbasa, CEO, Sticky Technology

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JDTraveler84
Reviews.Content: Overall, I will definitely NEVER stay here again. Upon my arrival in Vegas, I placed a phone call to the hotel asking about when I was able to check in. I was told 2 pm. I planned my day to be at the hotel around 2 pm. Once there, I was told I would not be able to check in for another 30-45 minutes. So, I waited and waited and waited, going back about 40 minutes later. Once again, I was told it'd be an additional 30 minutes til I could check in. I waited and waited and waited some more. Finally, about an hour and fifteen minutes after I was originally told I could check in, I was able to finally check in.......... but that my room wasn't ready yet. No problem... is there a place to store my bags? "Um... how many do you have? We have a little room... " as she motioned towards a small closet behind the front desk. Being as we had 3+ bags and didn't want my bags just placed in a storage closet, I decided to leave my bags in the car til I could FINALLY go to my room. Upon check-in, there was a dispute with my online reservation from their own website. I was not charged for the 3rd person staying in our room, though my reservation said VERY CLEARLY that I was charged for all 3 people. They insisted on charging me additionally for the 3rd person. Eventually, after about 10 minutes of "discussion", she would "do me a favor" and adjust the price. Very annoying. If your website confirmation email says I was charged one price for a certain number of guests, why when I get to the hotel is anything different? Why must I beg to be charged what my confirmation says? I don't need favors... I need consistency! The room itself, I suppose, was not horrible, but definitely not something to rush back to. The beds were very blah as were the pillows. At least 2 of the 3 of us woke up with some sort of neck/body pain that we attributed to the bed. Lastly (for the room), the temperature is VERY inconsistent. Keep that in mind if you are sensitive to heat/cold. The restaurant, as well, was very sub-par. When we first arrived, while waiting for check in, we had ordered nachos and the appetizer sampler. HORRIBLE!!! Bland, plastic-y, just all around NOT good. However, we had faith, and ordered a burger and wrap later, both of which were very good... though we seemed to wait forever for them. The staff, as a whole, was not very accomodating. It's obvious they are not thrilled about working there and that you are just another number to them. One gentleman at the restaurant was a semi-bright spot, as was one of the valet attendants. The lady at the front desk, other than the hassle with being charged incorrectly, was decent too. Also, must say, they have very beautiful dealers at the 4 card tables set up in the lobby. This was, perhaps, the best part about the hotel, sadly. Lastly, the hotel is located in what seemed to be a very seedy portion of downtown Vegas. We had no problems, but our walk from the hotel to the Fremont St Experience was slightly scary and I would not recommend doing it alone. Overall, I suppose you get what you pay for. I, for one, will never even think about staying here again. Do yourself a favor and stay either on Fremont Street, or on the actual strip itself. Whatever you do though, stay FAR away from this place. I was very excited to leave when the time came...

Reviews.Title: “This place is not for grandma”
Reviews.Author: johnnylawless
Reviews.Content: If you are a little tough it is fine - but this place requires you to walk amongst the most desperate and homeless drunks Vegas has to offer. We''ve stayed here twice using the $7.77 coupons in the Las Vegas Advisor. When calculating that great rate don't forget to factor in the $7.95/night resort fee that covers wireless internet but NOT ice machines (you can take the ice bucket through the casino and get ice at the bar). Each time we stayed here we parked the car and immediately was approached by one of the hardcore alcoholics that roam the streets nearby for change. They would not leave the area and watched in a stupor as we unloaded our car (there are no bellhops but you can use a cart). I left a bicycle locked to my car and the second time we stayed the seat was stolen off of it. I have travelled all over the country for most of the past 6 years and this is where it finally happened. If you do stay here do not leave anything valuable as these guys are so desperate for a drink they may smash your window for a nickel. As for the rooms, they are fine and all feature the same "Modern" Art - nice flat-screen television and the wireless internet worked great - the room was better than Binions the last time I was there for sure. The walk to Fremont Street is short and easy but not for anyone uncomfortable around street people. The casino was moslty dead when we were there although once they tried to get people to do Karaoke on a Thursday night. If you are a slot player - there is no paper ticket printout and you must wait for a slot attendant to come around and pay you, this took about 10 minutes so that is another downside. On the upside, all the staff are very friendly and happy to have visitors - the check-in/out was as easy as it gets. The cafe is open 24 hours and looks great for burgers and sandwiches but we didn't try it yet. I didn't see any fitness center but they claim one is going in.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: oldguy517
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Gold Spike by chance and were pleasantly suprised! The rooms are remodeled, cleand and comfortable. The restraunt has is clean and the food is great and reasonably priced. The gaming is great and the staff is always friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend The Gold Spike!

Reviews.Title: “Better than before, but still lot's of room for improvement...”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover999
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 days through Halloween week. Parking was a nightmare! Every space was tied up with people pulling in & walking over to Fremont St. Hotel guests/players were unable to get a spot! Checking in, I was not advised of wi-fi, pool or gym .... didn't find out until my 4th day there! (Charged $7.95 resort fee daily). Street thugs screaming & cursing @ the TV in restaurant were tolerated, even after waitress called for security. I requested a room facing Ogden Street 3 months in advance, but got one facing the parking lot in rear of bldg. I asked to speak with the manager 4 times during my stay, but he was either "unavailable" or "left for the day". I'd think that when a guest books for more than a weeks stay, he would want some feedback and comment... but guess not! Rooms were clean,food was good, slots were as loose as I've seen. BUT.. If I cant park within reasonable walking distance, I'd rather stay elsewhere. This is OK if you get a cheap enough rate, but I'd recommend the ElCortez over the Spike!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: beachbreeze66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Halloween. It was a block off of Freemont St and half the price of any of the hotels on Freemont Street. Our room was clean, newly upgraded, and comfy. We had a king size bed and flat screen tv. The bathroom was tiny but there was a large counter space in the bedroom as well. We pretty much just slept in the the room, we really were not staying there to hang out in the room and it met our needs. We were at the end of the hall but you could hear people coming and going from the room next to us. The parking is free and right next to the builiding. We order breakfast from the restaurant in the casino. You have to go down and get it but it was under $20 and more than enough average breakfast (Village Inn quality) food. I would stay here again if we were going to Freemont Street. I booked it on Hotels.com for $85.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value - excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: SamiKnight
Reviews.Content: I've been to vegas many times, and usually stay at the Golden Nugget. I wanted to try something new this time, so booked here. I managed to get a room for 4 people (2 twin beds) for an unbelievable £14. This sounded a little dubious, but the website said all rooms had been recently renovated. Upon check in, I couldn't have been happier, staff were friendly and efficient. The room was great, very clean and roomy. They had clearly been newly refurbished. There was free WiFi which is always great, and the gaming area downstairs was small but convenient. The pool area looked lovely, but I didn't get chance to use it. My only reason for not staying again would be that it is off of Fremont St, and so you do feel a little bit secluded. But for the price, you really cannot go wrong. Even at 4 times that price i'd have been happy.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of cable channels!”
Reviews.Author: BabyGirl45
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days at the Gold Spike Oct30-Nov8. I was in Vegas to celebrate my birthday Halloween . Tara at the front desk was a jewel. Heather at the bar was also great. The room was clean, had all the cable channels and more the IPod radio did not have a line for MP3 but I bought one on Fremont street. Bed was comfortable pillows soft. Maid was great a sweet lady had more that enough towels and lotions on request. I did not drink the 2.00 dollar a pop water because I wanted to get my 100.00 deposit back. LoL..I travel to Vegas often and plan to make the Gold Spike my PLACE. I have stayed at the Four Queens Golden Nugget Las Vegas Club Monte Carlo...I love the Gold Spike!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel, with a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: tatterdema
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 nights at the Gold Spike. They have done a really nice job remodeling their rooms, and the whole property in general. I would have to agree with the person who said Style over Substance though.... and agree with their issues about ice machines, pool, etc. It all appears to be done on the cheap, which is fine by me considering the rates. I was first in an Oasis room on the top floor overlooking the pool. The room was spotlessly clean, and well appointed. The room was a bit small, but not unbearably so. The elevator did not work, so if you have issues with stairs, make sure to be on the bottom floor of this annex. It was a Saturday night, and although busy, there was not enough noise at the pool to prevent me from going to sleep early (8pm) in the evening. I woke early in the morning, and went to take a shower. The handle broke, and I could not shut the water off. I had to call the front desk for help, and they sent up a security guard to shut it off. He was friendly and quickly got it torn apart and shut off, but could not fix it. I then moved to a room in the main tower. I was surprised to find this room even cleaner and nicer than the first room. It was a lot larger, and had a full wall of drawers, desk, etc. The plantation shutters do let light in, so it is impossible to get the room dark at night. This didnt bother me, just thought I would mention it. The beds in both rooms were of good quality, with clean, fresh linens, and large firm pillows. The few issue I had, are as follows: I asked twice for extra pillows, and both times was told that the hotel does not have any extra. The ice buckets do not have liners in them, which I find kind of unsanitary. There were not any towels at the pool for the duration of my stay. I was able to get a couple from a housekeeper, but I think they should have towels readily available...it is a pool after all. Finding parking is a bear, not impossible, but difficult. The restaurant had excellent diner style food at reasonable prices. I would go back to dine there again, even if I was not staying on property. Summary: If you are just looking for a clean, decently located place to lay your head at night, you really cannot go wrong here. The service was friendly, helpful, and quick. If you are looking for a resort experience, or tend to have special needs and wants, go somewhere else. I would not hesitate to stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very outgoing,friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: eddie071
Reviews.Content: The staff made us feel at home and were extremely friendly. Like they wanted us to be there and that they liked being there. The room and bed were very comfortable and we were able to unwind and relax. We were able to catch the "duece " and get where we needed to get back very easily. We were even able to take it to the airport on the day of our departure. The access to Fremont Street was good also. The food at restaurant was good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “I like the spike”
Reviews.Author: HOOAH777
Reviews.Content: I must say im very surprised by the NEW SPIKE. Way to go !!! the Front desk staff and the bar staff we surprisingly VEry friendly and helpful. I really like the the Gm he was more then happy to make our stay wonderful.. it was well worth every pennie I spent..

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: redheadandme
Reviews.Content: The rooms were just remodled and very clean.Equivelent to the rooms on the strip. No crowds like the strip but close enough to still go. Freemont st. one block away. Staff was very accomodating and helpful.We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I LIKE this place :)”
Reviews.Author: copesetic7777
Reviews.Content: The remodel turned out great.My king bed was Very firm and what little sleeping I did was sound. The $5.99 prime in the restaurant was VERY good and is easily worth twice as much(very tender,Au jus offered,potato DROWNED in butter and sour cream without asking,and ATOMIC horseradish, what's not to love :) ). I Know clean,33 years as a pro and this place is CLEAN. And for Blackjack fans,$3 min.3/2 payout dealt by some mua Bonita senoritas in the casino :) I will return

Reviews.Title: “The New Gold Spike - Nice Facelift!”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GS for one night on a 4 night trip for curiosity sake and found it to be a rather pleasant surprise. I have also recently stayed at the El Cortez Cabana Suites and to compare the 2, I like the Cabana Suites better. The GS has been completely renovated but the furniture is not of good quality which includes the beds. I believe the nicest part of the room is the huge flat screen tv with all the channels if you're one to watch tv while in Vegas! When replacing the tub wall tiles, they neglected to add a soap dish which makes it inconvenient while showering. They don't have a safety bar either and I would not recommend staying there if you are elderly or unsteady on your feet. The room was very clean and well maintained. The hallways were very quiet for a nice peaceful sleep. If you want ice, you will need to get from the bar downstairs. I ate at the diner and had their $5.95 prime rib special. Nothing special either but edible and filling. Blackjack tables have limited hours in the evening but the dealers are extremely friendly and minimum bets start at $3. I didn't play any slots as they don't have a players club yet so there's not much to benefit from if there's no club. They say that one is in the works though, we shall see. If you like staying downtown, give the Gold Spike a try. It was well worth the $19 for a Saturday night. One last tidbit, my credit card was charged $7.85 for a resort fee which is really kind of ridiculous for a hotel downtown when no other hotels charge a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yenism
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at the Golden nugget in downtown, i knew there wern't many places that could top that in downtown. But this time as we stayed for longer in vegas we decided to stay somewhere else... and we wern't disappointed. Located just off from fremont street the hotel is greatly situated, it takes a matter of few minutes to walk to the main street, so it wasn't such a big deal not staying on the main street. The value of the hotel is brilliant, the room was clean, shower was good and the bed was nice...oh and the digital tv was good too! Lots of channels, and they've even made a little menu to tell you what channels or what.... Nice touch! The only minor issue is that it hasn't got a safe in the room, and the pool is very nice, but the water very cold... we went there in late August time and it was on average 90 degrees + and still the water was cold. There were the only two issues really, not a biggy in my opinion and if you gave these little guys ago then you'll be pleasantly suprised aswell. The hotel casino does seem to cater for more locals, but i think its probably because tourist doesn't know about it, and it is very small - its mainly slot machines and there were 3 black jack tables that open in the evening for $3... now what more can you ask for...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean with a nice pool”
Reviews.Author: CCC_Samuelsson
Reviews.Content: Located "off-Strip" at the Fremont Experience, Gold Spike was clean and quiet, with a small pool area. The rooms were clean, everything looked new. They overcharged me for laundry but let me have it all for free once they realized their mistake, which was nice. Great value for money. Book online in advance for better rates!

Reviews.Title: “If you like rude hotel staff this dump is for you.”
Reviews.Author: dukesaysha
Reviews.Content: The manager at the hotel was the rudest lady i have ever delt with in my 46 years.They do a room inspection when you go to check out.This makes you feel like a criminal.What a joke!! The casino is filled with very drunk locals that are fighting all the time.I dont even smoke and the same drunks would try to mooch ciggs.every time i walked through the casino..I stayed in the hotel alone this trip.Than god!!! I would never bring my wife into a mess like this..I wouldnt stay in this dump again if they paid me.........

Reviews.Title: “A good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: Bostsean
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the Oasis rooms, which is a renovated motel next to the actual Gold Spike that hasn't been opened for too long. Everything in the room was brand-spanking new - new TV, bright new paint, new furniture. The room was small and basic, but not cramped, fine for sleeping, but you can't host a cocktail party there. Room was clean and housekeeping did a fine job during my stay. The bathroom was small but comfortable, everything worked as expected. The showerhead was low, not a problem for me but could be if you are on the taller side. A tiny problem - I reserved a smoking room, and there was no ashtray in the room. That was the biggest problem I ran into throughout my stay. The pool is also brand new, and open until 10:00!!! The pool area was very well kept. I'll even say it's the second-best pool downtown - which actually isn't saying too much. The casino basically consists of slots - table games only run one shift starting at 5:00. There is no craps(!) and no players club(!). The bar takes up maybe a third of the casino floor, and it's a good one. There is a small sports book window - it is a nice low-key place to place a bet and watch the game. The crowd was mostly locals, but they were a fun and unpretentious bunch. I didn't catch the bartender's name, but she was freindly and efficient. Most places have a casino with a bar in it, the Gold Spike seems more like a bar with a casino attached. I ate breakfast at the small coffee shop. The room was very nice and the service was excellent. I just had a couple of eggs and toast, which was fine but not the best breakfast downtown. The prices were very good though and I would eat there again. The pizza place on the other side of the casino was closed during my visit, I don't know if it's gone for good or not. A note about the neighborhood: the Gold Spike is a short walk to the Fremont St. canopy and the new owners are trying to shake off a bad reputation. The general area is slowly improving, but there are still some homeless people around. The hotel and casino had very good security though, police are present in the neighborhood, and I never felt unsafe in the area. Since the hotel is a bit away from the Fremont St. scene, the area was very quiet after ten PM or so. The Gold Spike is a good place to stay on a budget, with functional rooms and a pretty good pool. The staff was friendly and efficient, and it had a nice relaxed bar area. Rooms are a very good bargin, and I would stay there again. But why no player's club?

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for short stay”
Reviews.Author: seasidetraveler7
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed here for one night and it was well worth the $27 we paid. The room was just as it looks online and the remodel looks to be almost done (the gym was still closed). When we checked in our room had a slight mildew smell, but we turned on the AC and it was pretty much gone by the time we got in late at night. The staff was friendly and it was walking distance to Freemont St. My friend claims he saw a cockroach in the bathroom but I didn't see any. Overall I would stay again at a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Stop Going Back”
Reviews.Author: Sammasseur
Reviews.Content: I tried this place out for one night in February 2010, using the $7.77 coupon in American Casino Guide. And I felt guilty for not paying more. This place was recently gutted and rebuilt from the casino to the roof, and it shows. Clean, convenient, and gorgeous. Stayed again last month with friends, and going back in a few weeks for July 4th weekend. Splurged for three rooms for Halloween weekend to host friends, and only paid $170 total for 3 weekend nights for all three rooms!!! Also got New Year's Eve weekend reserved for only $50 per night. Try finding that anywhere else! The beds are very comfortable, flat screen TV's and plenty of luggage space, all new carpeting throughout the rooms and halls. Very fresh smell to everything. I am a dedicated customer. Good job, Gold Spike. BTW, I got those rates through hotels.com, not the Gold Spike website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, New amenities”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one day with a coupon from the American Casino Guide and were quite questioning of the neighborhood as the surrounding area is very seedy. they are well aware of this and have a large number of courteous security guards on site to deal with this issue. The front desk staff were all very nice as were all of the casino staff. the rooms were obviously just remodeled and although they were small they were a great bargain. $3 Blackjack was a great deal and there were plenty of spaces at the table.Overall a great experience for anyone wanting to stay in the downtown Vegas area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Room in the Dirtiest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonHarty
Reviews.Content: Stayed there quite a few years ago and it was the dirtiest scariest casino I had ever been to. The room however was pretty good in comparison. We rented the penthouse suite for 35 bucks a night. They have recently remodeled and the place is almost respectable. Where is the fun in that? I ranked it as average but the experience was unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible..... What a Joke”
Reviews.Author: MarkJ777
Reviews.Content: This place was nothing more than a dead body dug up from the grave. What a horrible experience. Stay away. its a disease palace.

Reviews.Title: “No Idea..”
Reviews.Author: CaseyD3
Reviews.Content: I booked through Expedia and when we got there found the Hotel to be under Remodle. Was sent to three different rooms before we where able to get one that was Fairly OK. The remodle will be nice and I am willing to try it out this year. I'll ask Questions FIRST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in more ways than one”
Reviews.Author: tomg99
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on a saturday night for $40. A very sketchy area, even for downtown. You have to walk through a smoke-filled casino to get to the hotel lobby. Filthy elevators. Apathetic staff. They gave us a bad room key on check-in. On check-out, they went to inspect the room before we left ---I have never had that happen before. The newly redecorated room had a large flat screen tv with lots of channels, but the whole room smelled like fresh paint. The hot water took a couple of minutes to warm up --- what a way to waste water in a desert! There were little bottles of drinking water with Gold Spike advertising label --- and a price of $2. We passed on the $13/day Wifi. I will not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like local not tourist 99.99% pleased with STAFF well cared for”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTessi
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED Worth Going Rates low price but Personal Quality of Staff HIGH.. First Walked in noticed was very clean Security Polite Sent me in right direction for check in where i Was well treated checked in was done very Quickly was able to watch and meet most Staff got older room but was Clean (peeked )at remodeled room Very Nice Brighter Job well done 2nd Floor was adding work out room (i peeked )watched as even Management jumped in and helped when needed serving ,cleaning.Loyal employees Great Respect toward Management noticed From Front Desk To Restaurant and Bar Casino Floor Cleaning Crews ,House Keeping ,all worked well together..SECURITY Was top of line in their Jobs Keeping all quiet in Casino Always Moving thru all areas Making sure all going well .Cars in parking area also watched by Security Met General Manager M.R Bazan He made sure all was well with stay .Restaurant treated very well by all Staff .Bar Tenders Made one feel as if you was regular remembered what you was drinking next day .. Staff Always Gave a Smile when i saw them..It was Great Feeling like part of the Group not Tourist .i Would Recommend When Staying there to Start off with a Smile and you will get plenty in Return .So Say Hi relax and enjoy Good Food Great Price FANTASTIC Staff in all areas Too many to list .. .tessi.thedockbabe@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location, good size clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marilyn1955
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Gold Spike. We got a great deal at $9 a night during the week and $17 for weekend because of renovation, which was not a problem. We stayed 8 nights and had a fabulous time. The hotel is clean, the room was a good size and the staff friendly and helpful. Just $4.99 for a 12 oz steak at the Gold Spike restaurant was a good dead. Location is great - just one block to the Deuce bus which runs 24 hrs and takes you to the strip, and just one block from fun Freemont Street. We were in Vegas for our daughter's wedding (they got married by Elvis at the Graceland Chapel). They chose to stay at the Flamingo on the Strip. We loved being downtown because it was less hectic. They enjoyed a stay at the Gold Spike on the last night because they were sick of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time Ever”
Reviews.Author: CLFKCD
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit Las Vegas at least once a year my parents about 4 times a year. We decided to do a family casino crawl and our second stop was GOLD SPIKE....lets just say our "crawl" ended their....we had a great time with the staff and the other people in the Casino. Gene was an excellent server and was running all over the place to help everyone....Rita was a riot and such a nice lady she brought out my family of 7 and 3 friends 2 huge plates of wings and some cake for free. We also were given T-shirts...overall the fun was the best part about this place...Great people, great time....."WE LOVE THE GOLD SPIKE< WE LOVE THE GOLD SPIKE" Next time in Vegas I will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everytime I visit the place is getting better.”
Reviews.Author: GGrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of nights over the New Years holiday (2009) and enjoyed our stay. We new ahead of time that the place was under renovation and we are very familiar with Downtown. My only complaint then was that our room showed wear and tear from years of use. I wasn't moldy, filthy, bad smelling or infested. Just old. We just finished up another trip to Vegas for July 4th and stopped be to check things out. A lot of progress has been made and it's looking better. They still have work to do but I'm considering staying again for New Years. All I can say about those that complain about the neighborhood is this, The front entrance is only one block away from the south end of The Fremont St Experience! Two trips - pleasant both times.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Rita the Pit Boss at all costs”
Reviews.Author: crokedrive
Reviews.Content: A friend has a blogsite and also writes for CasinoGuide in Las Vegas. He was impressed with Gold Spike and the upgrades and suggested we all go there for a night of fun on Friday, June 26th. Not only did he okay our large group of 15-20 people but verified it THREE times with management. We showed up in two limos at approximately 9 p.m. Friday night. Mind you, we are a fun group, tip to excess, and laugh our butts off even while losing. One pit boss RITA found our group to be a little too overwhelming. She went as far as to repirimand our tour guide for not giving HER a heads up that we would show up. In addition, she told one gentleman in our group that she would not have her cocktail waitresses "disrespected". If tipping them $25 per round and making them laugh their butts off is "disrespecting", RITA has more issues than just being a dried up old woman. It seemed to be common knowledge among the other employees that RITA was a liability and ruining what should have been a very profitable night for them. She actually closed the blackjack pit at midnight!!! I thought I was back in Central City, Colorado! In closing let me say ALL other employees were great! Peter (one of the other pitbosses), Jamie (a dealer), and everyone else. I will be writing a letter to the owner/management at the Gold Spike regarding RITA's assinine behaviour. In this economy, employees like her are worthless andn a huge liability to aany company. Karen from Denver

Reviews.Title: “NOT EVEN IF ITS FREE”
Reviews.Author: italy4me1
Reviews.Content: if you dont mind MOLD and FILTY AMOSTPHER this was the worst hotel ever there was MOLD on the walls by the bed and MOLD on the ceiling and in the bathrooms the floors was filty never mopped and called to have room service to clean what a joke the tub lift the tub matt surprize MOLD again then when you see the bedroom you cant even walk on the carpet from taking a bath it was so dirty visit room 507 for yourself no picture wish i did but i didnt want to waste my time its that bad i changed rooms before this 2 time they was the same but smelly really funky

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike=Dump!”
Reviews.Author: mozymarr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gold Spike for the weekend Friday-Sunday worst hotel experience of my life. The room was a dump very old, dirty ,tv didn't work leak in the tub and and it just looked run down and smelled horrible. They shouldn't rent these rooms for ANY price they couldn't pay ME to stay in them again. Save your money and book a hotel at a decent place in a nicer area.

Reviews.Title: “security sucks”
Reviews.Author: karrie67
Reviews.Content: my friend and i stayed at the spike for one night, we arrived early afternoon the casino,bar and restaurant are very clean, which is very impressive considering the way the outside looks. we had gambled at the bar most of the day and the bartenders are wonderful.When my friend and i were returning to our room in the early morning, we were harrassed by security, a very rude man named ED. He made us feel like we were low lifes. I have never been treated like this at any hotel. We then checked out that day and finished our stay at the plaza. Your security needs to treat people with more respect

Reviews.Title: “Gold Spike is great deal, but need a strategy”
Reviews.Author: KenKansasCity
Reviews.Content: The Gold Spike was a great deal . . . once I found a room that didn't have odor and had a working air conditioner. The people at the front desk were cooperative and it got done. STRATEGY - before you unpack your luggage 1.) check for odor. 2.) be sure cooling element works on a/c unit 3.) check the shower head for good pressure. 4.) check TV. 5.) lights A room switch at this point is fast and easy. PRICE - What a deal! fri- $30, sat-$30 , sun-$20, mon- $20 + tax = $111 ROOM 421 - good a/c, good shower head, good kg bed, good overstuffed chair. DINER - friendly people, yummy specials. Eat them. Bisquits and Gravy $1.29 (11pm-6am) Steak and Eggs $4.95 (11pm-6am), Steak & Shrimp $7.77 all time. Ham and Eggs $3.99 all the time. BAR - cheap! 99c frozen drinks $1.50 scooners of beer COUPONS - use them $5 bj matchplay, drawing, 10% off food CASINO - remodelled, but 1970s style penny slots are gone, but where have all the winos gone? RESTROOM in CASINO - high quality remodel and clean. BUS STATION - easy 4 minute walk. Return to Airport for $1.75. FREEMONT EXPERIENCE - easy 2 minute walk. Lots of FREE bands this summer under Freemont Experience - Rare Earth, Three Dog Night, Jefferson Starship, Canned Heat, 5th Demension, Big Brother and the Holding Company, Bill Haley's Comets Negatives: TV only 3 channels, one snowy Lamp had broken 0n/Off switch Light Bulbs (40W) too dull to read a newspaper Slow shower drain, but workable Using my strategy, given cheap rate . . . I'll return again. Ken from Kansas City

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lisahotmom
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a place to gamble it is perfect... but to sleep..you get what you pay for. As many deals as there are stay somewhere else until remodel is complete. The rooms were not done yet. Our room although clean was loud, had only two tv channels with no remote or power button , scaffolding outside the window which banged against the window all night with the wind and our power was knocked out. Funny as it was at the time there are plenty of hotels that offer the same rates. Construction starts early in the morning if you stay mon- fri. It is close to freemont, and parking is very close. staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “In Contruction”
Reviews.Author: SimiSu
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I held my breath when I entered my room because of the neighborhood I was in (downstown) and expected mystery stains, funky smells and a creaky bed for the price I paid......howeverrrrrrrrrr, I was pleasantly surprised and laughed at myself for the deal I had gotten. Though it's going through a renovation right now, the rooms are quite clean and pillows are nice and fluffy. Great value even though I didn't get a remote control and TV only has about 2 visible channels plus my bedside lamp was missing a bulb. I did notice most of the female card dealers and waitresses are cute 20 year olds!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is a 2 block walk through the ghetto”
Reviews.Author: jenniyoder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Spike one night. I had stayed in Vegas for a week at the Golden Nugget and Luxor. Our flight was delayed and I tried the Plaza, they were booked, but offered the Golden Spike (one of their sister proprities). Since money was tight, the price was right. However, the Spike is 2 blocks from Freemont Street, which means you must walk through the ghetto to get downtown. Also, the room was disgusting, yellowed, old, no remote for the TV, water was dirty and didn't work properly and there were quite a few scary characters. I don't suggest this hotel, basically you get EXACTLY what you pay for and then some. As a recommendation from the Plaza, I was disappointed, but I should have known better when I heard the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's really not as bad as everyone says...”
Reviews.Author: ugooli
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had to find a hotel the very last minute and I happened to stumble upon this hotel on Expedia. The price was just right for an overnight stay. I read all the reviews here so I came here knowing that it may not be all that. So it wasn't. But surprisingly, it was pretty good too. So here's my take on it... REGISTRATION/CASINO AREA: There's only one way in and out of this place; through the front door. Registration is in the back past the 4 rows of slot machines. All the broken slots are lined up by registration in front of the security desk which is an actual desk. Yes, there are no more table games either. But the signs outside say that a New Gold Spike is Coming Soon! We got there and there was someone sitting in the back who looked like she was about to fall asleep. I think i may have woken her up not seeing the sign on the counter that says "Will be back in 15 minutes". Haha. This is a first for a hotel/casino. But that was fine with us. We just walked back to the bar and got a couple of $1 beers while we watched a basketball game on TV. All the TVs are still CRT. The crowd is filled with locals waiting to go to work drinking beer. They were fun to hang out with while we were waiting for the registration desk to open. About half an hour later we went back and the lady at the front desk was very nice. She can even write upside down which was pretty cool. It was a totally different person than the one who was napping in the back. (NOTE: everyone staying in the hotel has to show their ID. You also have to get a parking pass which is free.) THE ROOM: We got our room for $55. You walk in and it smells like disinfectant but that goes away once you get used to it. The TV has about 4 channels available (no cable) and you have to put a $10 deposit on a remote if you'd like to borrow one. There's no iron/ironing board. There really is no closet. There's a long bar near the door to hang your clothes. There's also an armoire where the TV is. It's just fine for a couple days. The A/C is old and it's just enough to cool your room to room temperature. The beds are comfortable. In the bathroom you'll find conditioning shampoo and soap. That's it. The water pressure for the shower is surprisingly strong. So go down to the casino, win a few bucks and this place is paid for. There are at least 2 security guards at night outside the hotel. I didn't see one scary person outside at all at 2AM when I got back to the room. Overall, it's a pretty good place to stay for a night when you'd rather use your money for other things while you're in LV. The people here are nice too! Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “You're stayin' in the ghetto when you stay at the gold spike”
Reviews.Author: hellogretchy
Reviews.Content: This place is foul! Absolutely the worst hotel and casino you can get in the area! Disgusting in every way. Crack heads, hookers, and people you don't want to meet are here. Loosers and users hang out here. I was terrified my car was going to get broken into. The casino is a dirty joke, I would never want to touch any machine in the place. The room had no phone or remote control... need to deposit money to get those. No ice bucket because there is no ice machine, unlocking window which made me super nervous about leaving my room. No mirror on the wall because the druggies stole it. Dirty shower/ bathroom with a tub/shower whose drain barely works. Water is up to your knees in just a few minutes. This is by far the seediest hotel I have ever stayed in. I only stayed 12 hours, and I will NEVER be back. The only people who will enjoy this hotel are people who come from and are used to the ghetto. It truly is like a little piece of compton right there in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Spike!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jadedgirl13
Reviews.Content: My then Boyfriend and I drove up to get married... found the Spike,the staff was very helpful the drinks are a buck and the room was very clean and comfortable . We only stayed long enough to get hitched but we are going back this week and staying there again . For 27$ you can't beat the Spike for a place to crash in between partying on the strip.Love the Spike!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ilovekiayah
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the money...close to Freemont and the bus stop. Hotel was well lit on the inside. My non smoking room had no trace of smoke smell in it. The restaurant was great...closed a little early but that was okay. The front desk staff was friendly. My only complaint was that there were no aminities...such as extra toothbrushes, toothpaste or shuttle service to the airport. They also didn't have any complimentary wireless internet. Overall the hotel was good. I will stay there again when I come back to Vegas...unless I strike it rich! This hotel is perfect for someone who is in Vegas on a budget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at Gold spike”
Reviews.Author: tracii
Reviews.Content: My Husband And I Stayed At The Gold Spike On A Thursday we had a good time Gambling the staff was nice and parking was a breeze. We will Stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Webmistress595
Reviews.Content: I am very suprised that Expedia list this hotel as it is appalling. I arrived at 6pm (check in was from 3pm) but was told my room was not ready. I asked if there was anywhere to leave my luggage while I went for a drink and waited, I was told there was no where. So I was left standing in the grottiest casino in town surrounded by the dead beats in the casino. I asked again after 20 mins and the unhelpful, unsmiling desk guy said he would give me another room. I eventually went up to it and to be fair for what it cost it was ok. I opened the curtains to see the back of 5 airconditioning units and several filters that had been left on the roof. I kept the curtains closed for the rest of my stay. There was a TV but no remote control. Everytime I went out or came back I had to walk through the horrible dirty casino. It was always full of dodgy looking low life. The hotel is only 1 block from Fremont Street which is why I chose it but beware there are many homeless bums in this area. When I checked out I asked them to phone a cab for me but suprise suprise it never arrived. I don't think they ever rang one. I walked round the corner & hailed my own cab. One night I did have a bit of fun splatting a huge cockroach on the wall of my room with my shoe. I left it there for them to clean up but they never bothered. Take my advice there are plenty more cheap hotels in town that are better than this one. Give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Wooooooooo! Vivaaaaaaa Las Vegas :-D”
Reviews.Author: larissajustina
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends had a blast! Awesome employees, cheap 1 $ shots and beers. Really close to Freemont St. Free parking! We didn't go to LV to sit in our room so while it wasn't like the hilton or whatever, who cares! Cheap price.. like 110 for 3 nights? I'd def. stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: mariedeux
Reviews.Content: When you get to the front desk, you are not sure of what to expect! because it looks so so.... But the price is great, the room is reasonable. Good bed, cleaness ok. At the end a good deal.....

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: 757nurse
Reviews.Content: The reservations were not right, they would not cooperate with us. We booked 6 rooms for a wedding that weekend. Personnel were extremely rude.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as people say...”
Reviews.Author: Melodiek
Reviews.Content: This place was not as bad as people are saying it was. NOT NEARLY as bad. We booked for a whole week. May 2nd-May 9th and it was only 247 dollars...FOR THE WHOLE WEEK. I arrived there near midnight and the parking area was well lit. and i didnt see homeless people walking around like others have said. I am a woman and i didnt feel threatened at all, and i was by myself. You walk in to the casino and see all the electronic game machines and a big security booth right by the front doors. I checked in at the front desk and people were very helpful and polite. It did smell of smoke, but it was tolerable. Elevators worked nicely. Got to my room and I was expecting the worst after reading some of the reviews up here. But to my surprise my room didnt smell horrible as others have said and the room was clean. The air worked just fine. the tv DID only have 3 channels but i wasnt there to watch tv. In the room there was a round table with two chairs, a stand with the tv on it. a dresser another big oversized chair, two night stands and a bed. The restroom was smaller but did what it was needed for. The pluming is slow there but it never once got backed up...it was just slow. Wireless was available from this thing called cheetah network. You pre pay...we payed 30 dollars for the week, but u can pay by the hour or day if you'd like... and it was a decent connection. The bar was small...but useful and very inexpensive. we got two large drinks both with over 4 alcohols each for only 5 dollars. you cant find that anywhere else in vega. Plus shots and beers were only 1 dollar. The diner was sooo good. and very affordable. open 24 hours its convinient. THe first night we got cheese burgers and fries and drinks for only 8 somthing. and the cheese burgers were sooo big and good. everything we tried there was good and very affordable. we didnt eat one bad meal there. the hot dogs were HUGE for only 2 dollars and the breakfasts were big and yummy for only a little bit more... so over all it was 300 times better then i expected. the people were really nice and polite, and freemont street was 1 minute walking distance away. so was 24 hour walgreens. also what made it so worth it was a bus you can catch right infront of fremont street that takes u directly to the strip and stops at every hotel and comes ever 10 minutes. for only 5 dollars a day u can ride as much as you wnat up and down the strip. the bus was roomy and had two levels. VERY awesome. no doubt that i would spend another week at the gold spike. I attached some pictures. some of them are taken after we already messed up the room mind you lol. but you get the point.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be decieving!”
Reviews.Author: Tren2414
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived me where like "Oh no." The front desk clerk was slow and really weird. After checking in finally, we went to our hotel room and it was what we expected. If you've stayed in a Motel 6, its just like that. The room was clean and the bed weren't hard as a brick! It was a bit worn down but good for what we needed. You can't beat $32 a night for Friday and Sat.! The only downfall is the hotel doesn't have cable and we ony had 3 channels. I thought this was going to be a problem for me but it wasn't since we where barely in our room. I honestly would have liked cable since I might have stayed in the room more and not lost so much money gambling. All in all, it was a great place to crash and take a shower. I would stay again just for the price! Don't expect a Marriott but if you're OK with a Motel 6 type of place with no cable TV - this is the place for you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: fightpiter
Reviews.Content: We were splitting our trip between Vegas and Laughlin and decided that this place was cheap and worth a try. We have always stayed on the strip in the past and were curious about downtown so it worked out well. When we got there they put us in a standard room, although I had booked a "suite". After going back down and talking to the 1 person doing registrations they put us in the right room. To apologize for the error they charged me the cheaper rate for the 4 nights that we were there. The room itself was on the threadbare side. It was well worn but clean. Could certainly do with a coat of paint and some new carpet but... The room was fairly large with a balcony, not much of a view though. They were also putting new mattresses in the rooms while we were there. The casino was dirty with a fairly rough looking bunch gambling in there. While my wife didn't like it we had no troubles at all. They also have several security guards around all of the time. We even won a few bucks on their machines. The diner has seen better days but if you are a little adventurous the food can't be beat at their prices. Real plates would be nicer than the paper ones that they use but oh well. The location is only a couple blocks from Fremont Street but with the Lady Luck closed they are fairly dark blocks at night. That being said we made the trip several times on foot with no problems. In fact, we had more people stopping us for change on the strip than downtown. Finally the parking. While the lot is small and behind the hotel they have cameras and security in the lot most of the time. Plus, on the weekends and some nights, they have a guard in the lot making sure that you are gambling or staying at the hotel before they let you park. As a result we always had a parking spot. So to sum it all up we had a good time and would certainly consider staying here again if we were staying downtown. This hotel casino certainly isn't for everyone but if you have a sense of adventure it might be worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “For $45bucks on a Friday!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cowboylou
Reviews.Content: Dont get sacred away from a truely cheap place to stay in downtown Vegas. The rates monday thru thursday arent much of a deal but on the weekends, when everbody else jacks up thier room rates by $125 a nite the SPIKE SHINES. The Casino is very seedy and dump, but my room was clean and fair. TV remote was missing but there was plenty of hot water and a comfortable bed. Plenty of nice security people and checkin and checkout was simple. I will stay at the spike again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nice”
Reviews.Author: straav
Reviews.Content: Picked it as a cheap place to stay. Staff was great, the room as good as any budget hotel. Every one was happy with the hotel (3 friends were with me). An example of the service the staff picked up our scattered shoes and put the pairs nice and orderly in the closet. Something I have not seen at the $200+/nights hotels. Also the view from the suite was really good. I can only guess people giving the poor reviews have never stayed in a Super8, or some how figured that for $49 a night they were getting a some suite at the Rio. Would I go back again.... I'm going back in March 2007!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it! Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Beeeny
Reviews.Content: Two women travelling alone on a budget: Perfect! We payed $25.00 a night through Expedia. I expected the WORST after reading some of the reviews here, but was pleasantly surprised. We stayed on the non-smoking floor and had no issues with stale smoke. Yes, the room only had 4 channels, but we spent most of our time on Fremont St. Yep, the tub backed up when we showered, but we expected it from the reviews and it was not a big deal. We did not utilize the tiny, dark casino, I ate one sub-standard dinner and one great breakfast at the cafe. Again - casinos and food galore on Fremont street anyway! We were not bothered by anyone, we felt perfectly safe walking the short distance to Fremont. I read a review that there were bedbugs, and checked thoroughly for them when we arrived - there were none. If you are looking for a cheap place to crash while venturing out into Las Vegas, the Gold Spike is a great deal. I liked it, and will stay there again when travelling alone or with a female friend. BTW, if you are coming from the right direction, stop at the Nevada Visitor's Bureau in Boulder City on your way in, ask for the coupon that will get you a page of coupons at the Fremont St. kiosk. My friend and I ate 2-for-1 buffet every lunch and dinner the whole three days we stayed downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Found the Gold...”
Reviews.Author: Tushkat
Reviews.Content: The moment I went in I knew I had to write a review, for I had read many awful ones... Maybe I was expecting such a horrid hotel that it wasnt so bad but for me it was just what we needed. My boyfriend and I went to a convention on April 2007... we were both very happy with this hotel... some of my thoughts: The casino is not like the ones in the strip but it lets you feel a little more of a "real" "underground" Vegas... the people there are not turists and you can see it. At night (our room) got noisy... with the real sounds of the city... ambulances, police cars... so what? you are sleeping in a very BIG CLEAN bed... and have a very nice decent CLEAN bathroom with cool water pressure ;) the ONLY thing I didnt like and maybe if the hotel changed the ROOM CARPET it would look amazing... cause it was rather dirty... yet for that you have sandals! For the smoke smell... which is expected... use some incense or something and its gonna be fine! Didnt like the value meals though but if you have no money they can taste really good! Then... as a plus... you get the Fermont st. just like one block away! So for those that dont NEED the glamour lights and the big fancy hotels this is a perfect choice...(Specially if you have a car to move around!) Its cheap.. yet you dont get less for what you pay. I shouldnt recommend it so much 'cause then it might get too crowded! haha cheers! (couldnt take pictures sorry!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great for minimalism”
Reviews.Author: Bikeman982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last October and am planning on going again this year. All the reviews are correct. You can save some money, but you may be dissappointed with the accommodations. I didn't expect much and that was a good thing. The price was good, but the place is as described. Fortunately I was on the 5th floor and away from most of the smoke. The clientele that are at the hotel are definitely ecclectic. I only stayed in the room long enough to shower and sleep. I walked to the strip (only if you can walk a couple of miles). There were some individuals at the Blackjack tables that I made friends with and they seemed genuinely likeable. I did not worry about my safety outside - either in the parking lot or on the sidewalk walking to the strip. Would I recommend this to my friends - only if I tell them not to bring the wives (not the cleanest of accommodations). For me, it worked out well and I hope this year will be the same.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for the price!”
Reviews.Author: NL_Denver
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three week Las Vegas trip (yes, that's right, THREE weeks!). The duration of my and a buddy's trip was the reason for us to find the cheapest place possible. After doing some research, we found this place for an average of $30/night for the whole three weeks. Splitting it came to a spectacular $15/person/night which was great for three weeks. Now it is true that the casino reeks of cigarette smoke and the place is filled with locals (some with mental issues?) but overall I thought it was great. We minded our own business and no one bothered us. We stayed on the third floor (non-smoking floor) and upon arrival of our room....we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and a good size (2 queens) and the swamp cooler helped tremendously. The bathroom is SMALL but got the job done. Wireless internet is available through something called CheetahNetwork. Do NOT sign up for them unless you want internet that cuts out FREQUENTLY and is unreliable but does work occasionally (works great at about 5am). Maybe it was just my room?? The hotel is about a block away from Fremont Street which is the place to be if you're hanging out downtown. There was also a Walgreen's close by which was convenient for little things. We ate at the 24 hour diner a few times and it was satisfactory. VERY CHEAP food and not so bad tasting. Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay here considering the price I paid and I would happily stay again. However, I hope this doesn't offend anyone, but I would NOT recommend this place to any of my female friends because of the location, vibe in casino/lobby, and folks that hang out here. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Shabby Casino”
Reviews.Author: AnchorSkov
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for a week to play poker. The casino is dingy, dirty, smells and is somewhat unpleasant (but i came for the rooms not the casino). The gold spike had the cheapest rate that I could find so I booked it. It took a little time to check in as there is only one clerk. The elevator is old but worked fine, the room on the fifth floor was a suprise after comming thru the casino. The bed was nice the room was clean the shower worked great. I had no problems for the week I stayed at the gold spike. After reading some of the earlier reviews I wonder if the rooms on the lower levels of the hotel are nasty like the casino. There are a lot of not so well off people in and around the gold spike. There appeared to be plenty of security and police in the area as well. The parking lot is small and well lit. I went to try the "free" breakfast and overheard two of the cooks arguing about why they were out of bread. It looked dirty in the restrauant so I didn't stay and abandoned my gold spike dining experience. I suggest the following tactic if you are planning to stay at the gold spike. a.) bring a friend and make him or her check in and make sure he tips the clerk at least a twenty. b.) once checked in get a good gulp of fresh air (outside if you can find one) and hustle across the dingy smoke infested casino to the old but reliable elevator, c.) if you are lucky you won't have to smell the casio, get to your room and pretend you never had to go through the lower casio, d.) repeat the process to get out and back in. I have no idea what type of bar, machines, table games they have; because i didn't enjoy being in the casio at all. If you are tight and saving money makes you happy the gold spike experience is for you!

Reviews.Title: “A Horror Story”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our experience (my and I) was so terrible that I had to share it with everyone. We just returned home from our trip three days ago. We were set up by some bootleg travel agency(World Wide Travel Center) with this hotel. We entered a casino with smoke so thick that your hand could cut right through it not to mention that it even seeped up into the spaces where they called rooms. It was small, filthy, smelly, and had clogged drains, which no one came to fix after we requested this. I had to hold on to my husband for the prostitutes/cracheads looked as if they were ready to attack at any minute. We too inquired about the free breakfast, but it didn't matter cause we made up our minds not to eat here. Boy were we lucky! The old guy at the desk shirt was dirty and he had apersonality to match. I read the reviews before going, but I did not think it was possible for it to be this bad. Unfortunately when we returned in late that night we were greeted by buddies(big[--] crickets &roaches) that were waiting for us on the wall. This was when my husband could take more and checked us out and found another hotel who prices also were not bad but was clean, fun, and we had a wonderful stay(Golden Gate on Freemont Street).I'm glad someone finally posted pictures of what the dump really looks like. Why is there even a pool rating, cause they don't have one? People when the shuttle bus driver is feeling nervous about dropping you off here something is wrong. I dont understand how anyone on a budget or not could take this risk.

Reviews.Title: “at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: mccrayr
Reviews.Content: Where shall I begin? I guess I will start from the beggining We stayed June 11 and June 12th 2006. What a dump! We didn't read reviews until AFTER our stay (huge mistake) although we did look on their website. After we parked in their lot we were very skeptical. The lot had questionable people lurking about. We checked on our car several times a day to make sure it was still there and undamaged (nothing happened). I was approached but a guy in front of the building asking for money. From that point on my husband insisted on always being with me. We went to check-in, and we didn't have to wait (probably because they had very few customers.) They were friendly at the front desk, and had no problem with check-in or out. It was a good thing that we didn't stay in the room long because they had only 5 channels on the T.V. When we were in the room most of the channels were news. Unlike some guests we did have plenty of hot water, but we had to stand in a couple inches of water while we took showers. However we were not told how to get to our room, nor when check-in or check-out was. The room smelled moldy, and could have used a good cleaning. We seen on their website that they offered a free breakfast, so we figured that that might make up a little for how bad the room and hotel was, so we returned to the front desk to ask about the free meal only to be told that they discontinued the free meal. I told them about reading this on their website and she told me she knew it was on their website, but that there wasn't anything she could do. The next day we decided to try their cafe. I soon understood why they discontinued the free meal because it must have been running off business. We seen 3 employees walking around and eating while they were working. They were not attentive to the customers at all. We ordered hamburgers, fries, and salad. The salad sat on the counter, and we had to ask them for it upon getting our burgers. The salad had flies all around it so it wasn't edible (at least not for me). My husband liked the greasy burger, but I couldn't stomach it. Credit or debit cards are not accepted, but then again they were probably afraid we would stop the payment once we tried to eat their food. And if all this wasn't enough they had a systems check at 7am. Someone got on the intercom to tell everyone that they were conducting a test on their fire alarm. It started blaring, and scared the heck out of us when the loud speaker came on. The sirens and the announcement went continuance for an hour. They kept saying it was only a test, and to ignore it. After an hour they said that concluded their test. About 15 minutes later the siren went off again ths time no one came on to let us know if it was real or not, so we just stayed in our room. The longer we stayed at this dive the madder we became. Other then these listed it was a good hotel (yeah right). If you stay at the place your jeopardizing your health and your sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Our room had bed bugs too!”
Reviews.Author: fremontfan
Reviews.Content: The Gold Spike has cheap room rates, but it's a case of "you get what you pay for". Our room was filthy and we were told no other rooms available. Like this other reviewer wrote the rooms at the Gold Spike have bed bugs! The last morning there I woke up to find drops of blood on the bed sheets and red bite marks that itch, thanks to these critters! On my next trip to Las Vegas I won't be so cheap. I'm going to spend the money and stay at a hotel where the maids do their jobs and clean the rooms, and hotel management makes sure the rooms are free of bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Truly horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were BUGS IN MY BED! Unfortunately, I am allergic to insect bites, and this spoiled my whole vacation, of which Las Vegas was the first stop. I had booked and paid for the room on the Southwest website, so I could not get a refund. The man at the front desk was apologetic (but did not look very surprised), and offered to move me to another room. But the overall look of the place made me doubt if they had any rooms without bugs. The carpets were dirty, the room smelled really bad, and the air conditioner was incredibly noisy. A truly disgusting place.
